68 #include <array>
69 
70 extern LOCK_COMPATIBILITY lock_Comp[11][11];
71 
72 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
73 /* object lock hash function */
74 #define LK_OBJ_LOCK_HASH(oid,htsize) \
75  ((OID_ISTEMP(oid)) ? (unsigned int)(-((oid)->pageid) % htsize) :\
76  lock_get_hash_value(oid, htsize))
77 
78 /* thread is lock-waiting ? */
79 #define LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD(thrd) \
80  ((thrd)->lockwait != NULL \
81  && (thrd)->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
82 
83 /* transaction wait for only some msecs ? */
84 #define LK_CAN_TIMEOUT(msecs) ((msecs) != LK_INFINITE_WAIT)
85 
86 /* is younger transaction ? */
87 #define LK_ISYOUNGER(young_tranid, old_tranid) (young_tranid > old_tranid)
88 
89 /* Defines for printing lock activity messages */
90 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, msgnum) \
91  fprintf(stdout, \
92  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, msgnum)), \
93  (entry)->tran_index, LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING((entry)->granted_mode), \
94  (entry)->res_head->oid->volid, (entry)->res_head->oid->pageid, \
95  (entry)->oid->slotid)
96 
97 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_ACQUIRED(entry) \
98  LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_ACQUIRED)
99 
100 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_CONVERTED(entry) \
101  LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_CONVERTED)
102 
103 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_WAITFOR(entry) \
104  LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_WAITFOR)
105 
106 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_RELEASE(entry) \
107  LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_RELEASE)
108 
109 #define LK_MSG_LOCK_DEMOTE(entry) \
110  LK_MSG_LOCK_HELPER(entry, MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_DEMOTE)
111 
112 #define EXPAND_WAIT_FOR_ARRAY_IF_NEEDED() \
113  do \
114  { \
115  if (nwaits == max_waits) \
116  { \
117  if (wait_for == wait_for_buf) \
118  { \
119  t = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * max_waits * 2); \
120  if (t != NULL) \
121  { \
122  memcpy (t, wait_for, sizeof (int) * max_waits); \
123  } \
124  } \
125  else \
126  { \
127  t = (int *) realloc (wait_for, sizeof (int) * max_waits * 2); \
128  } \
129  if (t != NULL) \
130  { \
131  wait_for = t; \
132  max_waits *= 2; \
133  } \
134  else \
135  { \
136  goto set_error; \
137  } \
138  } \
139  } \
140  while (0)
141 
142 #define SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY(th,lock_entry) \
143  do \
144  { \
145  THREAD_ENTRY *locked_thread_entry_p; \
146  assert ((th)->emulate_tid == thread_id_t ()); \
147  locked_thread_entry_p = logtb_find_thread_by_tran_index ((lock_entry)->tran_index); \
148  if (locked_thread_entry_p != NULL) \
149  { \
150  (th)->emulate_tid = locked_thread_entry_p->get_id (); \
151  } \
152  } \
153  while (0)
154 
155 #define CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD(th) \
156  do \
157  { \
158  (th)->emulate_tid = thread_id_t (); \
159  } \
160  while (0)
161 
162 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
163 
164 #define RESOURCE_ALLOC_WAIT_TIME 10 /* 10 msec */
165 #define KEY_LOCK_ESCALATION_THRESHOLD 10 /* key lock escalation threshold */
166 #define MAX_NUM_LOCKS_DUMP_TO_EVENT_LOG 100
167 
168 /* state of suspended threads */
169 typedef enum
170 {
171  LOCK_SUSPENDED, /* Thread has been suspended */
172  LOCK_RESUMED, /* Thread has been resumed */
173  LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT, /* Thread has been resumed and notified of lock timeout */
174  LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT, /* Thread has been resumed and notified of lock timeout because the current
175  * transaction is selected as a deadlock victim */
176  LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED, /* Thread has been resumed, however it must be aborted because of a deadlock */
177  LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_FIRST, /* in case of the first aborted thread */
178  LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER, /* in case of other aborted threads */
179  LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT
180 } LOCK_WAIT_STATE;
181 
182 /*
183  * Message id in the set MSGCAT_SET_LOCK
184  * in the message catalog MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID (file cubrid.msg).
185  */
186 #define MSGCAT_LK_NEWLINE 1
187 #define MSGCAT_LK_SUSPEND_TRAN 2
188 #define MSGCAT_LK_RESUME_TRAN 3
189 #define MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_ACQUIRED 4
190 #define MSGCAT_LK_VPID_LOCK_ACQUIRED 5
191 #define MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_CONVERTED 6
192 #define MSGCAT_LK_VPID_LOCK_CONVERTED 7
193 #define MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_WAITFOR 8
194 #define MSGCAT_LK_VPID_LOCK_WAITFOR 9
195 #define MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_RELEASE 10
196 #define MSGCAT_LK_VPID_LOCK_RELEASE 11
197 #define MSGCAT_LK_OID_LOCK_DEMOTE 12
198 #define MSGCAT_LK_VPID_LOCK_DEMOTE 13
199 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_OID 14
200 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_ROOT_CLASS_TYPE 15
201 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_CLASS_TYPE 16
202 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_INSTANCE_TYPE 17
203 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_UNKNOWN_TYPE 18
204 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_TOTAL_MODE 19
205 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_LOCK_COUNT 20
206 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_NON_BLOCKED_HOLDER_HEAD 21
207 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_BLOCKED_HOLDER_HEAD 22
208 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_BLOCKED_WAITER_HEAD 23
209 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_NON2PL_RELEASED_HEAD 24
210 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_NON_BLOCKED_HOLDER_ENTRY 25
211 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_NON_BLOCKED_HOLDER_ENTRY_WITH_GRANULE 26
212 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_BLOCKED_HOLDER_ENTRY 27
213 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_BLOCKED_HOLDER_ENTRY_WITH_GRANULE 28
214 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_BLOCKED_WAITER_ENTRY 29
215 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_NON2PL_RELEASED_ENTRY 30
216 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_VPID 31
217 #define MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_LOCK_TABLE 32
218 #define MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_IDENTIFIERS 33
219 #define MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_ISOLATION 34
220 #define MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_STATE 35
221 #define MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_TIMEOUT_PERIOD 36
222 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_ABORT_HDR 37
223 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_ABORT 38
224 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT_HDR 39
225 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT 40
226 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_FUN_HDR 41
227 #define MSGCAT_LK_DEADLOCK_FUN 42
228 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_INDEX_KEY_TYPE 43
229 #define MSGCAT_LK_INDEXNAME 44
230 #define MSGCAT_LK_RES_RR_TYPE 45
231 #define MSGCAT_LK_MVCC_INFO 46
232 #define MSGCAT_LK_LASTONE 47
233 
234 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
235 
236 typedef struct lk_lockinfo LK_LOCKINFO;
237 struct lk_lockinfo
238 {
239  OID *org_oidp;
240  OID oid;
241  OID class_oid;
242  LOCK lock;
243 };
244 
245 
246 /* TWFG (transaction wait-for graph) entry and edge */
247 typedef struct lk_WFG_node LK_WFG_NODE;
248 struct lk_WFG_node
249 {
250  int first_edge;
251  bool candidate;
252  int current;
253  int ancestor;
254  INT64 thrd_wait_stime;
255  int tran_edge_seq_num;
256  bool checked_by_deadlock_detector;
257  bool DL_victim;
258 };
259 
260 typedef struct lk_WFG_edge LK_WFG_EDGE;
261 struct lk_WFG_edge
262 {
263  int to_tran_index;
264  int edge_seq_num;
265  int holder_flag;
266  int next;
267  INT64 edge_wait_stime;
268 };
269 
270 typedef struct lk_deadlock_victim LK_DEADLOCK_VICTIM;
271 struct lk_deadlock_victim
272 {
273  /* following two fields are used for only global deadlock detection */
274  int (*cycle_fun) (int tran_index, void *args);
275  void *args; /* Arguments to be passed to cycle_fun */
276 
277  int tran_index; /* Index of selected victim */
278  TRANID tranid; /* Transaction identifier */
279  bool can_timeout; /* Is abort or timeout */
280 
281  int num_trans_in_cycle; /* # of transaction in cycle */
282  int *tran_index_in_cycle; /* tran_index array for transaction in cycle */
283 };
284 
285 /*
286  * Lock Entry Block Structure
287  */
288 typedef struct lk_entry_block LK_ENTRY_BLOCK;
289 struct lk_entry_block
290 {
291  LK_ENTRY_BLOCK *next_block; /* next lock entry block */
292  LK_ENTRY *block; /* lk_entry block */
293  int count; /* # of entries in lock entry block */
294 };
295 
296 /*
297  * Lock Resource Block Structure
298  */
299 typedef struct lk_res_block LK_RES_BLOCK;
300 struct lk_res_block
301 {
302  LK_RES_BLOCK *next_block; /* next lock resource block */
303  LK_RES *block; /* lk_res block */
304  int count; /* # of entries in lock res block */
305 };
306 
307 /*
308  * Transaction Lock Entry Structure
309  */
310 typedef struct lk_tran_lock LK_TRAN_LOCK;
311 struct lk_tran_lock
312 {
313  /* transaction lock hold lists */
314  pthread_mutex_t hold_mutex; /* mutex for hold lists */
315  LK_ENTRY *inst_hold_list; /* instance lock hold list */
316  LK_ENTRY *class_hold_list; /* class lock hold list */
317  LK_ENTRY *root_class_hold; /* root class lock hold */
318  LK_ENTRY *lk_entry_pool; /* local pool of lock entries which can be used with no synchronization. */
319  int lk_entry_pool_count; /* Current count of lock entries in local pool. */
320  int inst_hold_count; /* # of entries in inst_hold_list */
321  int class_hold_count; /* # of entries in class_hold_list */
322 
323  LK_ENTRY *waiting; /* waiting lock entry */
324 
325  /* non two phase lock list */
326  pthread_mutex_t non2pl_mutex; /* mutex for non2pl_list */
327  LK_ENTRY *non2pl_list; /* non2pl list */
328  int num_incons_non2pl; /* # of inconsistent non2pl */
329 
330  /* lock escalation related fields */
331  bool lock_escalation_on;
332 
333  /* locking on manual duration */
334  bool is_instant_duration;
335 };
336 /* Max size of transaction local pool of lock entries. */
337 #define LOCK_TRAN_LOCAL_POOL_MAX_SIZE 10
338 
339 /*
340  * Lock Manager Global Data Structure
341  */
342 
343 typedef struct lk_global_data LK_GLOBAL_DATA;
344 struct lk_global_data
345 {
346  /* object lock table including hash table */
347  int max_obj_locks; /* max # of object locks */
348 
349  LF_HASH_TABLE obj_hash_table;
350  LF_FREELIST obj_free_res_list;
351  LF_FREELIST obj_free_entry_list;
352 
353  /* transaction lock table */
354  int num_trans; /* # of transactions */
355  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock_table; /* transaction lock hold table */
356 
357  /* deadlock detection related fields */
358  pthread_mutex_t DL_detection_mutex;
359  struct timeval last_deadlock_run; /* last deadlock detetion time */
360  LK_WFG_NODE *TWFG_node; /* transaction WFG node */
361  LK_WFG_EDGE *TWFG_edge; /* transaction WFG edge */
362  int max_TWFG_edge;
363  int TWFG_free_edge_idx;
364  int global_edge_seq_num;
365 
366  /* miscellaneous things */
367  short no_victim_case_count;
368  bool verbose_mode;
369  // *INDENT-OFF*
370  std::atomic_int deadlock_and_timeout_detector;
371  // *INDENT-ON*
372 #if defined(LK_DUMP)
373  bool dump_level;
374 #endif /* LK_DUMP */
375 };
376 
377 LK_GLOBAL_DATA lk_Gl = {
378  0, LF_HASH_TABLE_INITIALIZER,
379  LF_FREELIST_INITIALIZER, LF_FREELIST_INITIALIZER,
380  0, NULL, PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER, {0, 0},
381  NULL, NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0, false, {0}
382 #if defined(LK_DUMP)
383  , 0
384 #endif /* LK_DUMP */
385 };
386 
387 /* size of each data structure */
388 static const int SIZEOF_LK_LOCKINFO = sizeof (LK_LOCKINFO);
389 static const int SIZEOF_LK_WFG_NODE = sizeof (LK_WFG_NODE);
390 static const int SIZEOF_LK_WFG_EDGE = sizeof (LK_WFG_EDGE);
391 static const int SIZEOF_LK_TRAN_LOCK = sizeof (LK_TRAN_LOCK);
392 
393 static const int SIZEOF_LK_RES = sizeof (LK_RES);
394 static const int SIZEOF_LK_ENTRY_BLOCK = sizeof (LK_ENTRY_BLOCK);
395 static const int SIZEOF_LK_RES_BLOCK = sizeof (LK_RES_BLOCK);
396 static const int SIZEOF_LK_ACQOBJ_LOCK = sizeof (LK_ACQOBJ_LOCK);
397 
398 /* minimum # of locks that are required */
399 /* TODO : change const */
400 #define LK_MIN_OBJECT_LOCKS (MAX_NTRANS * 300)
401 
402 /* the ratio in the number of lock entries for each entry type */
403 static const int LK_HASH_RATIO = 8;
404 static const float LK_RES_RATIO = 0.1f;
405 static const float LK_ENTRY_RATIO = 0.1f;
406 
407 /* the lock entry expansion count */
408 /* TODO : change const */
409 #define LK_MORE_RES_COUNT (MAX_NTRANS * 20 * LK_RES_RATIO)
410 #define LK_MORE_ENTRY_COUNT (MAX_NTRANS * 20 * LK_ENTRY_RATIO)
411 
412 /* miscellaneous constants */
413 static const int LK_SLEEP_MAX_COUNT = 3;
414 #define LK_LOCKINFO_FIXED_COUNT 30
415 /* TODO : change const */
416 #define LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT 300
417 
418 /* transaction WFG edge related constants */
419 static const int LK_MIN_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT = 200;
420 /* TODO : change const */
421 #define LK_MID_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT 1000
422 /* TODO : change const */
423 #define LK_MAX_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT (MAX_NTRANS * MAX_NTRANS)
424 
425 #define DEFAULT_WAIT_USERS 10
426 static const int LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK_OID_INCREMENT = 100;
427 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
428 
429 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
430 
431 static LK_WFG_EDGE TWFG_edge_block[LK_MID_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT];
432 static LK_DEADLOCK_VICTIM victims[LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT];
433 static int victim_count;
434 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
435 static int lk_Standalone_has_xlock = 0;
436 #define LK_SET_STANDALONE_XLOCK(lock) \
437  do { \
438  if ((lock) == SCH_M_LOCK || (lock) == X_LOCK || lock == IX_LOCK \
439  || lock == SIX_LOCK) \
440  { \
441  lk_Standalone_has_xlock = true; \
442  } \
443  } while (0)
444 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
445 
446 const size_t DEFAULT_LOCK_WAITING_THREAD_ARRAY_SIZE = 10;
447 // *INDENT-OFF*
448 using tran_lock_waiters_array_type = std::array<THREAD_ENTRY *, DEFAULT_LOCK_WAITING_THREAD_ARRAY_SIZE>;
449 // *INDENT-ON*
450 
451 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
452 static void lock_initialize_entry (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr);
453 static void lock_initialize_entry_as_granted (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int tran_index, LK_RES * res, LOCK lock);
454 static void lock_initialize_entry_as_blocked (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index,
455  LK_RES * res, LOCK lock);
456 static void lock_initialize_entry_as_non2pl (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int tran_index, LK_RES * res, LOCK lock);
457 static void lock_initialize_resource (LK_RES * res_ptr);
458 static void lock_initialize_resource_as_allocated (LK_RES * res_ptr, LOCK lock);
459 static unsigned int lock_get_hash_value (const OID * oid, int htsize);
460 static int lock_initialize_tran_lock_table (void);
461 static int lock_initialize_object_hash_table (void);
462 static int lock_initialize_object_lock_res_list (void);
463 static int lock_initialize_object_lock_entry_list (void);
464 static int lock_initialize_deadlock_detection (void);
465 static int lock_remove_resource (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr);
466 static void lock_insert_into_tran_hold_list (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int owner_tran_index);
467 static int lock_delete_from_tran_hold_list (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int owner_tran_index);
468 static void lock_insert_into_tran_non2pl_list (LK_ENTRY * non2pl, int owner_tran_index);
469 static int lock_delete_from_tran_non2pl_list (LK_ENTRY * non2pl, int owner_tran_index);
470 static LK_ENTRY *lock_find_tran_hold_entry (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, const OID * oid, bool is_class);
471 static bool lock_force_timeout_expired_wait_transactions (void *thrd_entry);
472 static bool lock_is_local_deadlock_detection_interval_up (void);
473 static void lock_detect_local_deadlock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
474 static bool lock_is_class_lock_escalated (LOCK class_lock, LOCK lock_escalation);
475 static LK_ENTRY *lock_add_non2pl_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr, int tran_index, LOCK lock);
476 static void lock_position_holder_entry (LK_RES * res_ptr, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr);
477 static void lock_set_error_for_timeout (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr);
478 static void lock_set_error_for_aborted (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr);
479 static void lock_set_tran_abort_reason (int tran_index, TRAN_ABORT_REASON abort_reason);
480 static LOCK_WAIT_STATE lock_suspend (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int wait_msecs);
481 static void lock_resume (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int state);
482 static bool lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout (int tran_index);
483 static bool lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted (int tran_index);
484 static void lock_grant_blocked_holder (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr);
485 static int lock_grant_blocked_waiter (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr);
486 static void lock_grant_blocked_waiter_partial (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr, LK_ENTRY * from_whom);
487 static bool lock_check_escalate (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * class_entry, LK_TRAN_LOCK * tran_lock);
488 static int lock_escalate_if_needed (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * class_entry, int tran_index);
489 static int lock_internal_hold_lock_object_instant (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, const OID * oid,
490  const OID * class_oid, LOCK lock);
491 static int lock_internal_perform_lock_object (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, const OID * oid,
492  const OID * class_oid, LOCK lock, int wait_msecs,
493  LK_ENTRY ** entry_addr_ptr, LK_ENTRY * class_entry);
494 static void lock_internal_perform_unlock_object (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, bool release_flag,
495  bool move_to_non2pl);
496 static void lock_unlock_object_by_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation,
497  const OID * class_oid, const OID * oid);
498 static void lock_unlock_inst_locks_of_class_by_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index,
499  TRAN_ISOLATION isolation, const OID * class_oid);
500 static int lock_internal_demote_class_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, LOCK to_be_lock,
501  LOCK * ex_lock);
502 static void lock_demote_all_shared_class_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index);
503 static void lock_unlock_shared_inst_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, const OID * inst_oid);
504 static void lock_remove_all_class_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, LOCK lock);
505 static void lock_remove_non2pl (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * non2pl, int tran_index);
506 static void lock_update_non2pl_list (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr, int tran_index, LOCK lock);
507 static int lock_add_WFG_edge (int from_tran_index, int to_tran_index, int holder_flag, INT64 edge_wait_stime);
508 static void lock_select_deadlock_victim (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int s, int t);
509 static void lock_dump_deadlock_victims (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * outfile);
510 static int lock_compare_lock_info (const void *lockinfo1, const void *lockinfo2);
511 static float lock_wait_msecs_to_secs (int msecs);
512 static void lock_dump_resource (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * outfp, LK_RES * res_ptr);
513 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
514 static bool lock_check_consistent_resource (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr);
515 static bool lock_check_consistent_tran_lock (LK_TRAN_LOCK * tran_lock);
516 #endif
517 
518 static void lock_increment_class_granules (LK_ENTRY * class_entry);
519 
520 static void lock_decrement_class_granules (LK_ENTRY * class_entry);
521 static LK_ENTRY *lock_find_class_entry (int tran_index, const OID * class_oid);
522 
523 static void lock_event_log_tran_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, int tran_index);
524 static void lock_event_log_blocked_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * entry);
525 static void lock_event_log_blocking_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * wait_entry);
526 static void lock_event_log_lock_info (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * entry);
527 static void lock_event_set_tran_wait_entry (int tran_index, LK_ENTRY * entry);
528 static void lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry (int tran_index, LK_ENTRY * entry);
529 static LK_RES_KEY lock_create_search_key (OID * oid, OID * class_oid);
530 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
531 static bool lock_is_safe_lock_with_page (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr);
532 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
533 
534 static LK_ENTRY *lock_get_new_entry (int tran_index, LF_TRAN_ENTRY * tran_entry, LF_FREELIST * freelist);
535 static void lock_free_entry (int tran_index, LF_TRAN_ENTRY * tran_entry, LF_FREELIST * freelist, LK_ENTRY * lock_entry);
536 
537 static void lock_victimize_first_thread_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper);
538 static void lock_check_timeout_expired_and_count_suspended_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper,
539  size_t & suspend_count);
540 static void lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper,
541  int tran_index,
542  tran_lock_waiters_array_type & tran_lock_waiters,
543  size_t & count);
544 static void lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads (int tran_index, tran_lock_waiters_array_type & tran_lock_waiters,
545  size_t & count);
546 
547 // *INDENT-OFF*
548 static cubthread::daemon *lock_Deadlock_detect_daemon = NULL;
549 
550 static void lock_deadlock_detect_daemon_init ();
551 static void lock_deadlock_detect_daemon_destroy ();
552 // *INDENT-ON*
553 
554 /* object lock entry */
555 static void *lock_alloc_entry (void);
556 static int lock_dealloc_entry (void *res);
557 static int lock_init_entry (void *res);
558 static int lock_uninit_entry (void *res);
559 
560 LF_ENTRY_DESCRIPTOR obj_lock_entry_desc = {
561  offsetof (LK_ENTRY, stack),
562  offsetof (LK_ENTRY, next),
563  offsetof (LK_ENTRY, del_id),
564  0, /* does not have a key, not used in a hash table */
565  0, /* does not have a mutex, protected by resource mutex */
566  LF_EM_NOT_USING_MUTEX,
567  lock_alloc_entry,
568  lock_dealloc_entry,
569  lock_init_entry,
570  lock_uninit_entry,
571  NULL,
572  NULL,
573  NULL, /* no key */
574  NULL /* no inserts */
575 };
576 
577 /*
578  * Object lock resource
579  */
580 static void *lock_alloc_resource (void);
581 static int lock_dealloc_resource (void *res);
582 static int lock_init_resource (void *res);
583 static int lock_uninit_resource (void *res);
584 static int lock_res_key_copy (void *src, void *dest);
585 static int lock_res_key_compare (void *k1, void *k2);
586 static unsigned int lock_res_key_hash (void *key, int htsize);
587 
588 LF_ENTRY_DESCRIPTOR obj_lock_res_desc = {
589  offsetof (LK_RES, stack),
590  offsetof (LK_RES, hash_next),
591  offsetof (LK_RES, del_id),
592  offsetof (LK_RES, key),
593  offsetof (LK_RES, res_mutex),
594  LF_EM_USING_MUTEX,
595  lock_alloc_resource,
596  lock_dealloc_resource,
597  lock_init_resource,
598  lock_uninit_resource,
599  lock_res_key_copy,
600  lock_res_key_compare,
601  lock_res_key_hash,
602  NULL /* no inserts */
603 };
604 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
605 
606 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
607 static LK_RES_KEY
608 lock_create_search_key (OID * oid, OID * class_oid)
609 {
610  LK_RES_KEY search_key;
611 
612  /* copy *IDs */
613  if (oid != NULL)
614  {
615  COPY_OID (&search_key.oid, oid);
616  }
617  else
618  {
619  OID_SET_NULL (&search_key.oid);
620  }
621 
622  if (class_oid != NULL)
623  {
624  COPY_OID (&search_key.class_oid, class_oid);
625  }
626  else
627  {
628  OID_SET_NULL (&search_key.class_oid);
629  }
630 
631  /* set correct type */
632  if (oid != NULL && OID_IS_ROOTOID (oid))
633  {
634  search_key.type = LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS;
635  }
636  else
637  {
638  if (class_oid == NULL || OID_IS_ROOTOID (class_oid))
639  {
640  search_key.type = LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS;
641  }
642  else
643  {
644  search_key.type = LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE;
645  }
646  }
647 
648  /* done! */
649  return search_key;
650 }
651 
652 static void *
653 lock_alloc_entry (void)
654 {
655  return malloc (sizeof (LK_ENTRY));
656 }
657 
658 static int
659 lock_dealloc_entry (void *res)
660 {
661  free (res);
662  return NO_ERROR;
663 }
664 
665 static int
666 lock_init_entry (void *entry)
667 {
668  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr = (LK_ENTRY *) entry;
669  if (entry_ptr != NULL)
670  {
671  return NO_ERROR;
672  }
673  else
674  {
675  assert (false);
676  return ER_FAILED;
677  }
678 }
679 
680 static int
681 lock_uninit_entry (void *entry)
682 {
683  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr = (LK_ENTRY *) entry;
684 
685  if (entry_ptr == NULL)
686  {
687  return ER_FAILED;
688  }
689 
690  entry_ptr->tran_index = -1;
691  entry_ptr->thrd_entry = NULL;
692 
693  return NO_ERROR;
694 }
695 
696 static void *
697 lock_alloc_resource (void)
698 {
699  LK_RES *res_ptr = (LK_RES *) malloc (sizeof (LK_RES));
700  if (res_ptr != NULL)
701  {
702  pthread_mutex_init (&(res_ptr->res_mutex), NULL);
703  }
704  return res_ptr;
705 }
706 
707 static int
708 lock_dealloc_resource (void *res)
709 {
710  LK_RES *res_ptr = (LK_RES *) res;
711  if (res_ptr != NULL)
712  {
713  pthread_mutex_destroy (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
714  free (res_ptr);
715  return NO_ERROR;
716  }
717  else
718  {
719  assert (false);
720  return ER_FAILED;
721  }
722 }
723 
724 static int
725 lock_init_resource (void *res)
726 {
727  LK_RES *res_ptr = (LK_RES *) res;
728 
729  if (res_ptr == NULL)
730  {
731  return ER_FAILED;
732  }
733 
734  res_ptr->total_holders_mode = NULL_LOCK;
735  res_ptr->total_waiters_mode = NULL_LOCK;
736  res_ptr->holder = NULL;
737  res_ptr->waiter = NULL;
738  res_ptr->non2pl = NULL;
739  res_ptr->hash_next = NULL;
740 
741  return NO_ERROR;
742 }
743 
744 static int
745 lock_uninit_resource (void *res)
746 {
747  LK_RES *res_ptr = (LK_RES *) res;
748 
749  if (res == NULL)
750  {
751  return ER_FAILED;
752  }
753 
754  assert (res_ptr->holder == NULL);
755  assert (res_ptr->waiter == NULL);
756  assert (res_ptr->non2pl == NULL);
757 
758  /* TO BE FILLED IN AS NECESSARY */
759 
760  return NO_ERROR;
761 }
762 
763 static int
764 lock_res_key_copy (void *src, void *dest)
765 {
766  LK_RES_KEY *src_k = (LK_RES_KEY *) src;
767  LK_RES_KEY *dest_k = (LK_RES_KEY *) dest;
768 
769  if (src_k == NULL || dest_k == NULL)
770  {
771  return ER_FAILED;
772  }
773 
774  dest_k->type = src_k->type;
775  switch (src_k->type)
776  {
777  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
778  COPY_OID (&dest_k->oid, &src_k->oid);
779  COPY_OID (&dest_k->class_oid, &src_k->class_oid);
780  break;
781 
782  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
783  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
784  COPY_OID (&dest_k->oid, &src_k->oid);
785  OID_SET_NULL (&dest_k->class_oid);
786  break;
787 
788  case LOCK_RESOURCE_OBJECT:
789  /* nothing, it's a free object */
790  break;
791 
792  default:
793  assert (false);
794  return ER_FAILED;
795  }
796 
797  return NO_ERROR;
798 }
799 
800 static int
801 lock_res_key_compare (void *k1, void *k2)
802 {
803  LK_RES_KEY *k1_k = (LK_RES_KEY *) k1;
804  LK_RES_KEY *k2_k = (LK_RES_KEY *) k2;
805 
806  if (k1_k == NULL || k2_k == NULL)
807  {
808  return 1;
809  }
810 
811  switch (k1_k->type)
812  {
813  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
814  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
815  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
816  /* fast and dirty oid comparison */
817  if (OID_EQ (&k1_k->oid, &k2_k->oid))
818  {
819  assert (k1_k->type == k2_k->type);
820 
821  /* equal */
822  return 0;
823  }
824  else
825  {
826  /* not equal */
827  return 1;
828  }
829  break;
830 
831  case LOCK_RESOURCE_OBJECT:
832  default:
833  /* unfortunately, there's no error reporting here, but an always-true comparison will generate errors early on
834  * and is easier to spot */
835  assert (false);
836  return 0;
837  }
838 }
839 
840 static unsigned int
841 lock_res_key_hash (void *key, int htsize)
842 {
843  LK_RES_KEY *key_k = (LK_RES_KEY *) key;
844 
845  if (key_k != NULL)
846  {
847  return LK_OBJ_LOCK_HASH (&key_k->oid, htsize);
848  }
849  else
850  {
851  assert (false);
852  return 0;
853  }
854 }
855 
856 /* initialize lock entry as free state */
857 static void
858 lock_initialize_entry (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr)
859 {
860  entry_ptr->tran_index = -1;
861  entry_ptr->thrd_entry = NULL;
862  entry_ptr->res_head = NULL;
863  entry_ptr->granted_mode = NULL_LOCK;
864  entry_ptr->blocked_mode = NULL_LOCK;
865  entry_ptr->next = NULL;
866  entry_ptr->tran_next = NULL;
867  entry_ptr->tran_prev = NULL;
868  entry_ptr->class_entry = NULL;
869  entry_ptr->ngranules = 0;
870  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
871  entry_ptr->bind_index_in_tran = -1;
872  XASL_ID_SET_NULL (&entry_ptr->xasl_id);
873 }
874 
875 /* initialize lock entry as granted state */
876 static void
877 lock_initialize_entry_as_granted (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int tran_index, LK_RES * res, LOCK lock)
878 {
879  entry_ptr->tran_index = tran_index;
880  entry_ptr->thrd_entry = NULL;
881  entry_ptr->res_head = res;
882  entry_ptr->granted_mode = lock;
883  entry_ptr->blocked_mode = NULL_LOCK;
884  entry_ptr->count = 1;
885  entry_ptr->next = NULL;
886  entry_ptr->tran_next = NULL;
887  entry_ptr->tran_prev = NULL;
888  entry_ptr->class_entry = NULL;
889  entry_ptr->ngranules = 0;
890  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
891 
892  lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry (tran_index, entry_ptr);
893 }
894 
895 /* initialize lock entry as blocked state */
896 static void
897 lock_initialize_entry_as_blocked (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, LK_RES * res,
898  LOCK lock)
899 {
900  entry_ptr->tran_index = tran_index;
901  entry_ptr->thrd_entry = thread_p;
902  entry_ptr->res_head = res;
903  entry_ptr->granted_mode = NULL_LOCK;
904  entry_ptr->blocked_mode = lock;
905  entry_ptr->count = 1;
906  entry_ptr->next = NULL;
907  entry_ptr->tran_next = NULL;
908  entry_ptr->tran_prev = NULL;
909  entry_ptr->class_entry = NULL;
910  entry_ptr->ngranules = 0;
911  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
912 
913  lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry (tran_index, entry_ptr);
914 }
915 
916 /* initialize lock entry as non2pl state */
917 static void
918 lock_initialize_entry_as_non2pl (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int tran_index, LK_RES * res, LOCK lock)
919 {
920  entry_ptr->tran_index = tran_index;
921  entry_ptr->thrd_entry = NULL;
922  entry_ptr->res_head = res;
923  entry_ptr->granted_mode = lock;
924  entry_ptr->blocked_mode = NULL_LOCK;
925  entry_ptr->count = 0;
926  entry_ptr->next = NULL;
927  entry_ptr->tran_next = NULL;
928  entry_ptr->tran_prev = NULL;
929  entry_ptr->class_entry = NULL;
930  entry_ptr->ngranules = 0;
931  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
932 }
933 
934 /* initialize lock resource as free state */
935 static void
936 lock_initialize_resource (LK_RES * res_ptr)
937 {
938  pthread_mutex_init (&(res_ptr->res_mutex), NULL);
939  res_ptr->key.type = LOCK_RESOURCE_OBJECT;
940  OID_SET_NULL (&(res_ptr->key.oid));
941  OID_SET_NULL (&(res_ptr->key.class_oid));
942  res_ptr->total_holders_mode = NULL_LOCK;
943  res_ptr->total_waiters_mode = NULL_LOCK;
944  res_ptr->holder = NULL;
945  res_ptr->waiter = NULL;
946  res_ptr->non2pl = NULL;
947  res_ptr->hash_next = NULL;
948 }
949 
950 /* initialize lock resource as allocated state */
951 static void
952 lock_initialize_resource_as_allocated (LK_RES * res_ptr, LOCK lock)
953 {
954  res_ptr->total_holders_mode = lock;
955  res_ptr->total_waiters_mode = NULL_LOCK;
956  res_ptr->holder = NULL;
957  res_ptr->waiter = NULL;
958  res_ptr->non2pl = NULL;
959 }
960 
961 /*
962  * lock_get_hash_value -
963  *
964  * return:
965  *
966  * oid(in):
967  */
968 static unsigned int
969 lock_get_hash_value (const OID * oid, int htsize)
970 {
971  unsigned int next_base_slotid, addr;
972 
973  if (oid->slotid <= 0)
974  {
975  /* In an unique index, the OID and ClassOID of the last key are <root page's volid, root page's pageid, -1> and
976  * <root page's volid, root page's pageid, 0>, recpectively. In a non-unique index, the OID of the last key is
977  * <root page's volid, root page's pageid, -1> */
978  addr = oid->pageid - oid->slotid;
979  }
980  else
981  {
982  next_base_slotid = 2;
983  while (next_base_slotid <= (unsigned) oid->slotid)
984  {
985  next_base_slotid = next_base_slotid * 2;
986  }
987 
988  addr = oid->pageid + (htsize / next_base_slotid) * (2 * oid->slotid - next_base_slotid + 1);
989  }
990 
991  return (addr % htsize);
992 }
993 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
994 
995 /*
996  * Private Functions Group 1: initalize and finalize major structures
997  *
998  * - lock_init_tran_lock_table()
999  * - lock_init_object_hash_table()
1000  * - lock_init_object_lock_res_list()
1001  * - lock_init_object_lock_entry_list()
1002  * - lock_init_deadlock_detection()
1003  */
1004 
1005 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1006 /*
1007  * lock_initialize_tran_lock_table - Initialize the transaction lock hold table.
1008  *
1009  * return: error code
1010  *
1011  * Note:This function allocates the transaction lock hold table and
1012  * initializes the table.
1013  */
1014 static int
1015 lock_initialize_tran_lock_table (void)
1016 {
1017  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock; /* pointer to transaction hold entry */
1018  int i, j; /* loop variable */
1019  LK_ENTRY *entry = NULL;
1020 
1021  /* initialize the number of transactions */
1022  lk_Gl.num_trans = MAX_NTRANS;
1023 
1024  /* allocate memory space for transaction lock table */
1025  lk_Gl.tran_lock_table = (LK_TRAN_LOCK *) malloc (SIZEOF_LK_TRAN_LOCK * lk_Gl.num_trans);
1026  if (lk_Gl.tran_lock_table == NULL)
1027  {
1028  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
1029  (size_t) (SIZEOF_LK_TRAN_LOCK * lk_Gl.num_trans));
1030  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1031  }
1032 
1033  /* initialize all the entries of transaction lock table */
1034  memset (lk_Gl.tran_lock_table, 0, SIZEOF_LK_TRAN_LOCK * lk_Gl.num_trans);
1035  for (i = 0; i < lk_Gl.num_trans; i++)
1036  {
1037  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[i];
1038  pthread_mutex_init (&tran_lock->hold_mutex, NULL);
1039  pthread_mutex_init (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex, NULL);
1040 
1041  for (j = 0; j < LOCK_TRAN_LOCAL_POOL_MAX_SIZE; j++)
1042  {
1043  entry = (LK_ENTRY *) malloc (sizeof (LK_ENTRY));
1044  lock_initialize_entry (entry);
1045  entry->next = tran_lock->lk_entry_pool;
1046  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool = entry;
1047  }
1048  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count = LOCK_TRAN_LOCAL_POOL_MAX_SIZE;
1049  }
1050 
1051  return NO_ERROR;
1052 }
1053 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1054 
1055 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1056 /*
1057  * lock_initialize_object_hash_table - Initializes the object lock hash table
1058  *
1059  * return: error code
1060  *
1061  * Note:This function initializes an object lock hash table.
1062  */
1063 static int
1064 lock_initialize_object_hash_table (void)
1065 {
1066 #define LK_INITIAL_OBJECT_LOCK_TABLE_SIZE 10000
1067  int obj_hash_size, ret;
1068 
1069  lk_Gl.max_obj_locks = LK_INITIAL_OBJECT_LOCK_TABLE_SIZE;
1070 
1071  /* allocate an object lock hash table */
1072  if (lk_Gl.max_obj_locks > LK_MIN_OBJECT_LOCKS)
1073  {
1074  obj_hash_size = lk_Gl.max_obj_locks * LK_HASH_RATIO;
1075  }
1076  else
1077  {
1078  obj_hash_size = LK_MIN_OBJECT_LOCKS * LK_HASH_RATIO;
1079  }
1080 
1081  /* initialize object hash table */
1082  ret = lf_hash_init (&lk_Gl.obj_hash_table, &lk_Gl.obj_free_res_list, obj_hash_size, &obj_lock_res_desc);
1083  if (ret != NO_ERROR)
1084  {
1085  return ret;
1086  }
1087 
1088  return NO_ERROR;
1089 }
1090 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1091 
1092 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1093 /*
1094  * lock_initialize_object_lock_res_list - Initializes the object lock resource list
1095  *
1096  * return: error code
1097  *
1098  * Note:
1099  * This function initializes following two lists.
1100  * 1. a list of object lock resource block
1101  * => each block has object lock resource block.
1102  * 2. a list of freed object lock resource entries.
1103  */
1104 static int
1105 lock_initialize_object_lock_res_list (void)
1106 {
1107  int block_size, block_count, ret;
1108 
1109  /* initialize */
1110  block_count = 1;
1111  block_size = (int) MAX ((lk_Gl.max_obj_locks * LK_RES_RATIO), 1);
1112  ret = lf_freelist_init (&lk_Gl.obj_free_res_list, block_count, block_size, &obj_lock_res_desc, &obj_lock_res_Ts);
1113  if (ret != NO_ERROR)
1114  {
1115  return ret;
1116  }
1117 
1118  return NO_ERROR;
1119 }
1120 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1121 
1122 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1123 /*
1124  * lockk_initialize_object_lock_entry_list - Initializes the object lock entry list
1125  *
1126  * return: error code
1127  *
1128  * Note:
1129  * This function initializes following two lists.
1130  * 1. a list of object lock entry block
1131  * => each node has object lock entry block.
1132  * 2. a list of freed object lock entries.
1133  */
1134 static int
1135 lock_initialize_object_lock_entry_list (void)
1136 {
1137  int block_count, block_size, ret;
1138 
1139  /* initialize the entry freelist */
1140  block_count = 1;
1141  block_size = (int) MAX ((lk_Gl.max_obj_locks * LK_ENTRY_RATIO), 1);
1142  ret = lf_freelist_init (&lk_Gl.obj_free_entry_list, block_count, block_size, &obj_lock_entry_desc, &obj_lock_ent_Ts);
1143  if (ret != NO_ERROR)
1144  {
1145  return ER_FAILED;
1146  }
1147 
1148  return NO_ERROR;
1149 }
1150 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1151 
1152 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1153 /*
1154  * lock_initialize_deadlock_detection - Initializes transaction wait-for graph.
1155  *
1156  * return: error code
1157  *
1158  * Note:This function initializes the transaction waif-for graph.
1159  */
1160 static int
1161 lock_initialize_deadlock_detection (void)
1162 {
1163  int i;
1164 
1165  pthread_mutex_init (&lk_Gl.DL_detection_mutex, NULL);
1166  gettimeofday (&lk_Gl.last_deadlock_run, NULL);
1167 
1168  /* allocate transaction WFG node table */
1169  lk_Gl.TWFG_node = (LK_WFG_NODE *) malloc (SIZEOF_LK_WFG_NODE * lk_Gl.num_trans);
1170  if (lk_Gl.TWFG_node == NULL)
1171  {
1172  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
1173  (size_t) (SIZEOF_LK_WFG_NODE * lk_Gl.num_trans));
1174  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1175  }
1176  /* initialize transaction WFG node table */
1177  for (i = 0; i < lk_Gl.num_trans; i++)
1178  {
1179  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].DL_victim = false;
1180  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].checked_by_deadlock_detector = false;
1181  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].thrd_wait_stime = 0;
1182  }
1183 
1184  /* initialize other related fields */
1185  lk_Gl.TWFG_edge = NULL;
1186  lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge = 0;
1187  lk_Gl.TWFG_free_edge_idx = -1;
1188  lk_Gl.global_edge_seq_num = 0;
1189 
1190  return NO_ERROR;
1191 }
1192 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1193 
1194 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1195 /*
1196  * lock_remove_resource - Remove lock resource entry
1197  *
1198  * return: error code
1199  *
1200  * res_ptr(in):
1201  *
1202  * Note:This function removes the given lock resource entry from lock hash table.
1203  */
1204 static int
1205 lock_remove_resource (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr)
1206 {
1207  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_OBJ_LOCK_RES);
1208  int success = 0, rc;
1209 
1210  rc = lf_hash_delete_already_locked (t_entry, &lk_Gl.obj_hash_table, (void *) &res_ptr->key, res_ptr, &success);
1211  if (!success)
1212  {
1213  /* this should not happen, as the hash entry is mutex protected and no clear operations are performed on the hash
1214  * table */
1215  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
1216  assert_release (false);
1217  return ER_FAILED;
1218  }
1219  else
1220  {
1221  assert (rc == NO_ERROR);
1222  return rc;
1223  }
1224 }
1225 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1226 
1227 /*
1228  * Private Functions Group: transaction lock list related functios
1229  * - lk_insert_into_tran_hold_list()
1230  * - lk_delete_from_tran_hold_list()
1231  * - lk_insert_into_tran_non2pl_list()
1232  * - lk_delete_from_tran_non2pl_list()
1233  */
1234 
1235 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1236 /*
1237  * lock_insert_into_tran_hold_list - Insert the given lock entry
1238  * into the transaction lock hold list
1239  *
1240  * return: nothing
1241  *
1242  * entry_ptr(in):
1243  *
1244  * Note:This function inserts the given lock entry into the transaction lock
1245  * hold list. The given lock entry was included in the lock holder
1246  * list. That is, The lock is held by the transaction.
1247  */
1248 static void
1249 lock_insert_into_tran_hold_list (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int owner_tran_index)
1250 {
1251  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1252  int rv;
1253 
1254  /* The caller is holding a resource mutex */
1255 
1256  if (owner_tran_index != entry_ptr->tran_index)
1257  {
1258  assert (owner_tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
1259  return;
1260  }
1261 
1262  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[entry_ptr->tran_index];
1263  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1264 
1265  switch (entry_ptr->res_head->key.type)
1266  {
1267  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
1268 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1269  if (tran_lock->root_class_hold != NULL)
1270  {
1271  fprintf (stderr, "lk_insert_into_tran_hold_list() error.. (1)\n");
1272  }
1273 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1274  entry_ptr->tran_next = tran_lock->root_class_hold;
1275  tran_lock->root_class_hold = entry_ptr;
1276  break;
1277 
1278  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
1279 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1280  if (tran_lock->class_hold_list != NULL)
1281  {
1282  LK_ENTRY *_ptr;
1283  _ptr = tran_lock->class_hold_list;
1284  while (_ptr != NULL)
1285  {
1286  if (_ptr->res_head == entry_ptr->res_head)
1287  {
1288  break;
1289  }
1290  _ptr = _ptr->tran_next;
1291  }
1292  if (_ptr != NULL)
1293  {
1294  fprintf (stderr, "lk_insert_into_tran_hold_list() error.. (2)\n");
1295  }
1296  }
1297 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1298  if (tran_lock->class_hold_list != NULL)
1299  {
1300  tran_lock->class_hold_list->tran_prev = entry_ptr;
1301  }
1302  entry_ptr->tran_next = tran_lock->class_hold_list;
1303  tran_lock->class_hold_list = entry_ptr;
1304  tran_lock->class_hold_count++;
1305  break;
1306 
1307  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
1308 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1309  if (tran_lock->inst_hold_list != NULL)
1310  {
1311  LK_ENTRY *_ptr;
1312  _ptr = tran_lock->inst_hold_list;
1313  while (_ptr != NULL)
1314  {
1315  if (_ptr->res_head == entry_ptr->res_head)
1316  {
1317  break;
1318  }
1319  _ptr = _ptr->tran_next;
1320  }
1321  if (_ptr != NULL)
1322  {
1323  fprintf (stderr, "lk_insert_into_tran_hold_list() error.. (3)\n");
1324  }
1325  }
1326 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1327  if (tran_lock->inst_hold_list != NULL)
1328  {
1329  tran_lock->inst_hold_list->tran_prev = entry_ptr;
1330  }
1331  entry_ptr->tran_next = tran_lock->inst_hold_list;
1332  tran_lock->inst_hold_list = entry_ptr;
1333  tran_lock->inst_hold_count++;
1334  break;
1335 
1336  default:
1337  break;
1338  }
1339 
1340  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1341 }
1342 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1343 
1344 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1345 /*
1346  * lock_delete_from_tran_hold_list - Delted the given lock entry
1347  * from the transaction lock hold list
1348  *
1349  * return: error code
1350  *
1351  * entry_ptr(in):
1352  *
1353  * Note:This functions finds the given lock entry in the transaction
1354  * lock hold list and then deletes it from the lock hold list.
1355  */
1356 static int
1357 lock_delete_from_tran_hold_list (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int owner_tran_index)
1358 {
1359  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1360  int rv;
1361  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1362 
1363  /* The caller is holding a resource mutex */
1364 
1365  if (owner_tran_index != entry_ptr->tran_index)
1366  {
1367  assert (owner_tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
1368  return ER_FAILED;
1369  }
1370 
1371  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[entry_ptr->tran_index];
1372  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1373 
1374  switch (entry_ptr->res_head->key.type)
1375  {
1376  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
1377  if (entry_ptr != tran_lock->root_class_hold)
1378  { /* does not exist */
1379  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_NOTFOUND_IN_TRAN_HOLD_LIST, 7,
1380  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry_ptr->granted_mode), "ROOT CLASS", entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.volid,
1381  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.pageid, entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.slotid, entry_ptr->tran_index,
1382  (tran_lock->root_class_hold == NULL ? 0 : 1));
1383  error_code = ER_LK_NOTFOUND_IN_TRAN_HOLD_LIST;
1384  }
1385  else
1386  {
1387  tran_lock->root_class_hold = NULL;
1388  }
1389  break;
1390 
1391  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
1392  if (tran_lock->class_hold_list == entry_ptr)
1393  {
1394  tran_lock->class_hold_list = entry_ptr->tran_next;
1395  if (entry_ptr->tran_next)
1396  {
1397  entry_ptr->tran_next->tran_prev = NULL;
1398  }
1399  }
1400  else
1401  {
1402  if (entry_ptr->tran_prev)
1403  {
1404  entry_ptr->tran_prev->tran_next = entry_ptr->tran_next;
1405  }
1406  if (entry_ptr->tran_next)
1407  {
1408  entry_ptr->tran_next->tran_prev = entry_ptr->tran_prev;
1409  }
1410  }
1411  tran_lock->class_hold_count--;
1412  break;
1413 
1414  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
1415  if (tran_lock->inst_hold_list == entry_ptr)
1416  {
1417  tran_lock->inst_hold_list = entry_ptr->tran_next;
1418  if (entry_ptr->tran_next)
1419  {
1420  entry_ptr->tran_next->tran_prev = NULL;
1421  }
1422  }
1423  else
1424  {
1425  if (entry_ptr->tran_prev)
1426  {
1427  entry_ptr->tran_prev->tran_next = entry_ptr->tran_next;
1428  }
1429  if (entry_ptr->tran_next)
1430  {
1431  entry_ptr->tran_next->tran_prev = entry_ptr->tran_prev;
1432  }
1433  }
1434  tran_lock->inst_hold_count--;
1435  break;
1436 
1437  default:
1438  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_INVALID_OBJECT_TYPE, 4, entry_ptr->res_head->key.type,
1439  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.volid, entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.pageid,
1440  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.slotid);
1441  error_code = ER_LK_INVALID_OBJECT_TYPE;
1442  break;
1443  }
1444 
1445  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1446 
1447  return error_code;
1448 }
1449 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1450 
1451 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1452 /*
1453  * lock_insert_into_tran_non2pl_list - Insert the given lock entry
1454  * into the transaction non2pl list
1455  *
1456  * return: nothing
1457  *
1458  * non2pl(in):
1459  *
1460  * Note:This function inserts the given lock entry into the transaction
1461  * non2pl list.
1462  */
1463 static void
1464 lock_insert_into_tran_non2pl_list (LK_ENTRY * non2pl, int owner_tran_index)
1465 {
1466  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1467  int rv;
1468 
1469  /* The caller is holding a resource mutex */
1470 
1471  if (owner_tran_index != non2pl->tran_index)
1472  {
1473  assert (owner_tran_index == non2pl->tran_index);
1474  return;
1475  }
1476 
1477  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[non2pl->tran_index];
1478  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1479 
1480  non2pl->tran_next = tran_lock->non2pl_list;
1481  tran_lock->non2pl_list = non2pl;
1482  if (non2pl->granted_mode == INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK)
1483  {
1484  tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl += 1;
1485  }
1486 
1487  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1488 }
1489 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1490 
1491 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1492 /*
1493  * lock_delete_from_tran_non2pl_list - Delete the given lock entry
1494  * from the transaction non2pl list
1495  *
1496  * return: error code
1497  *
1498  * non2pl(in):
1499  *
1500  * Note:This function finds the given lock entry in the transaction
1501  * non2pl list and then deletes it from the non2pl list.
1502  */
1503 static int
1504 lock_delete_from_tran_non2pl_list (LK_ENTRY * non2pl, int owner_tran_index)
1505 {
1506  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1507  LK_ENTRY *prev, *curr;
1508  int rv;
1509  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1510 
1511  /* The caller is holding a resource mutex */
1512 
1513  if (owner_tran_index != non2pl->tran_index)
1514  {
1515  assert (owner_tran_index == non2pl->tran_index);
1516  return ER_FAILED;
1517  }
1518 
1519  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[non2pl->tran_index];
1520  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1521 
1522  /* find the given non2pl entry in transaction non2pl list */
1523  prev = NULL;
1524  curr = tran_lock->non2pl_list;
1525  while (curr != NULL && curr != non2pl)
1526  {
1527  prev = curr;
1528  curr = curr->tran_next;
1529  }
1530  if (curr == NULL)
1531  { /* not found */
1532  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_NOTFOUND_IN_TRAN_NON2PL_LIST, 5,
1533  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (non2pl->granted_mode),
1534  (non2pl->res_head != NULL ? non2pl->res_head->key.oid.volid : -2),
1535  (non2pl->res_head != NULL ? non2pl->res_head->key.oid.pageid : -2),
1536  (non2pl->res_head != NULL ? non2pl->res_head->key.oid.slotid : -2), non2pl->tran_index);
1537  error_code = ER_LK_NOTFOUND_IN_TRAN_NON2PL_LIST;
1538  }
1539  else
1540  { /* found */
1541  /* delete it from the transaction non2pl list */
1542  if (prev == NULL)
1543  {
1544  tran_lock->non2pl_list = curr->tran_next;
1545  }
1546  else
1547  {
1548  prev->tran_next = curr->tran_next;
1549  }
1550 
1551  if (curr->granted_mode == INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK)
1552  {
1553  tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl -= 1;
1554  }
1555  }
1556  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1557 
1558  return error_code;
1559 }
1560 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1561 
1562 /*
1563  * Private Functions Group: lock entry addition related functions
1564  * - lk_add_non2pl_lock()
1565  * - lk_position_holder_entry()
1566  */
1567 
1568 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1569 /*
1570  * lock_find_class_entry - Find a class lock entry
1571  * in the transaction lock hold list
1572  *
1573  * return:
1574  *
1575  * tran_index(in):
1576  * class_oid(in):
1577  *
1578  * Note:This function finds a class lock entry, whose lock object id
1579  * is the given class_oid, in the transaction lock hold list.
1580  */
1581 static LK_ENTRY *
1582 lock_find_class_entry (int tran_index, const OID * class_oid)
1583 {
1584  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1585  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr;
1586  int rv;
1587 
1588  /* The caller is not holding any mutex */
1589 
1590  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
1591  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1592 
1593  if (OID_IS_ROOTOID (class_oid))
1594  {
1595  entry_ptr = tran_lock->root_class_hold;
1596  }
1597  else
1598  {
1599  entry_ptr = tran_lock->class_hold_list;
1600  while (entry_ptr != NULL)
1601  {
1602  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
1603 
1604  if (OID_EQ (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid, class_oid))
1605  {
1606  break;
1607  }
1608  entry_ptr = entry_ptr->tran_next;
1609  }
1610  }
1611 
1612  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
1613 
1614  return entry_ptr; /* it might be NULL */
1615 }
1616 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1617 
1618 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1619 /*
1620  * lock_add_non2pl_lock - Add a release lock which has never been acquired
1621  *
1622  * return: pointer to the lock entry in non2pl list.
1623  *
1624  * res_ptr(in): pointer to lock resource
1625  * tran_index(in): transaction table index
1626  * lock(in): the lock mode of non2pl lock
1627  *
1628  * Note:Cache a release lock (which has never been acquired) onto the list
1629  * of non two phase lock to detect future serializable inconsistencies
1630  *
1631  */
1632 static LK_ENTRY *
1633 lock_add_non2pl_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_RES * res_ptr, int tran_index, LOCK lock)
1634 {
1635  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_OBJ_LOCK_ENT);
1636  LK_ENTRY *non2pl;
1637  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
1638  int rv;
1639  LOCK_COMPATIBILITY compat;
1640 
1641  assert (!OID_ISNULL (&res_ptr->key.oid));
1642 
1643  /* The caller is holding a resource mutex */
1644 
1645  /* find the non2pl entry of the given transaction */
1646  non2pl = res_ptr->non2pl;
1647  while (non2pl != NULL)
1648  {
1649  if (non2pl->tran_index == tran_index)
1650  {
1651  break;
1652  }
1653  non2pl = non2pl->next;
1654  }
1655 
1656  if (non2pl != NULL)
1657  {
1658  /* 1. I have a non2pl entry on the lock resource */
1659  /* reflect the current lock acquisition into the non2pl entry */
1660  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
1661  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1662 
1663  if (non2pl->granted_mode != INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK)
1664  {
1665  if (lock == INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK)
1666  {
1667  non2pl->granted_mode = INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK;
1668  tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl += 1;
1669  }
1670  else
1671  {
1672  assert (lock >= NULL_LOCK && non2pl->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1673  compat = lock_Comp[lock][non2pl->granted_mode];
1674  assert (compat != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1675 
1676  if (compat == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
1677  {
1678  non2pl->granted_mode = INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK;
1679  tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl += 1;
1680  }
1681  else
1682  {
1683  non2pl->granted_mode = lock_Conv[lock][non2pl->granted_mode];
1684  assert (non2pl->granted_mode != NA_LOCK);
1685  }
1686  }
1687  }
1688 
1689  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
1690  }
1691  else
1692  { /* non2pl == (LK_ENTRY *)NULL */
1693  /* 2. I do not have a non2pl entry on the lock resource */
1694  /* allocate a lock entry, initialize it, and connect it */
1695  non2pl = lock_get_new_entry (tran_index, t_entry, &lk_Gl.obj_free_entry_list);
1696  if (non2pl != NULL)
1697  {
1698  lock_initialize_entry_as_non2pl (non2pl, tran_index, res_ptr, lock);
1699  non2pl->next = res_ptr->non2pl;
1700  res_ptr->non2pl = non2pl;
1701  lock_insert_into_tran_non2pl_list (non2pl, tran_index);
1702  }
1703  else
1704  {
1705  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_ALLOC_RESOURCE, 1, "lock heap entry");
1706  }
1707  }
1708  return non2pl; /* it might be NULL */
1709 }
1710 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1711 
1712 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1713 /*
1714  * lock_position_holder_entry - Position given lock entry in the lock
1715  * holder list of given lock resource
1716  *
1717  * return:
1718  *
1719  * res_ptr(in):
1720  * entry_ptr(in):
1721  *
1722  * Note:This function positions the given lock entry
1723  * in the lock holder list of the given lock resource
1724  * according to Upgrader Positioning Rule(UPR).
1725  *
1726  * NOTE that the granted_mode and blocked_mode of the given lock
1727  * entry must be set before this function is called.
1728  */
1729 static void
1730 lock_position_holder_entry (LK_RES * res_ptr, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr)
1731 {
1732  LK_ENTRY *prev, *i;
1733  LK_ENTRY *ta, *tap;
1734  LK_ENTRY *tb, *tbp;
1735  LK_ENTRY *tc, *tcp;
1736  LOCK_COMPATIBILITY compat1, compat2;
1737 
1738  /* find the position where the lock entry to be inserted */
1739  if (entry_ptr->blocked_mode == NULL_LOCK)
1740  {
1741  /* case 1: when block_mode is NULL_LOCK */
1742  prev = NULL;
1743  i = res_ptr->holder;
1744  while (i != NULL)
1745  {
1746  if (i->blocked_mode == NULL_LOCK)
1747  {
1748  break;
1749  }
1750  prev = i;
1751  i = i->next;
1752  }
1753  }
1754  else
1755  {
1756  /* case 2: when block_mode is not NULL_LOCK */
1757  /* find ta, tb, tc among other holders */
1758  ta = tb = tc = NULL;
1759  tap = tbp = tcp = NULL;
1760 
1761  prev = NULL;
1762  i = res_ptr->holder;
1763  while (i != NULL)
1764  {
1765  if (i->blocked_mode != NULL_LOCK)
1766  {
1767  assert (entry_ptr->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK && entry_ptr->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1768  assert (i->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK && i->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1769 
1770  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry_ptr->blocked_mode][i->blocked_mode];
1771  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1772 
1773  if (ta == NULL && compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_YES)
1774  {
1775  ta = i;
1776  tap = prev;
1777  }
1778 
1779  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry_ptr->blocked_mode][i->granted_mode];
1780  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1781 
1782  compat2 = lock_Comp[i->blocked_mode][entry_ptr->granted_mode];
1783  assert (compat2 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1784 
1785  if (ta == NULL && tb == NULL && compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_YES && compat2 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
1786  {
1787  tb = i;
1788  tbp = prev;
1789  }
1790  }
1791  else
1792  {
1793  if (tc == NULL)
1794  {
1795  tc = i;
1796  tcp = prev;
1797  }
1798  }
1799  prev = i;
1800  i = i->next;
1801  }
1802  if (ta != NULL)
1803  {
1804  prev = tap;
1805  }
1806  else if (tb != NULL)
1807  {
1808  prev = tbp;
1809  }
1810  else if (tc != NULL)
1811  {
1812  prev = tcp;
1813  }
1814  }
1815 
1816  /* insert the given lock entry into the found position */
1817  if (prev == NULL)
1818  {
1819  entry_ptr->next = res_ptr->holder;
1820  res_ptr->holder = entry_ptr;
1821  }
1822  else
1823  {
1824  entry_ptr->next = prev->next;
1825  prev->next = entry_ptr;
1826  }
1827 }
1828 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1829 
1830 
1831 /*
1832  * Private Functions Group: timeout related functions
1833  *
1834  * - lock_set_error_for_timeout()
1835  * - lock_set_error_for_aborted()
1836  * - lock_suspend(), lock_resume()
1837  * - lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout()
1838  * - lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted()
1839  */
1840 
1841 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1842 /*
1843  * lock_set_error_for_timeout - Set error for lock timeout
1844  *
1845  * return:
1846  *
1847  * entry_ptr(in): pointer to the lock entry for waiting
1848  *
1849  * Note:Set error code for lock timeout
1850  */
1851 static void
1852 lock_set_error_for_timeout (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr)
1853 {
1854  char *client_prog_name; /* Client program name for transaction */
1855  char *client_user_name; /* Client user name for transaction */
1856  char *client_host_name; /* Client host for transaction */
1857  int client_pid; /* Client process id for transaction */
1858  char *waitfor_client_users_default = (char *) "";
1859  char *waitfor_client_users; /* Waitfor users */
1860  char *classname; /* Name of the class */
1861  int n, i, nwaits, max_waits = DEFAULT_WAIT_USERS;
1862  int wait_for_buf[DEFAULT_WAIT_USERS];
1863  int *wait_for = wait_for_buf, *t;
1864  LK_ENTRY *entry;
1865  LK_RES *res_ptr = NULL;
1866  int unit_size = LOG_USERNAME_MAX + MAXHOSTNAMELEN + PATH_MAX + 20 + 4;
1867  char *ptr;
1868  int rv;
1869  bool is_classname_alloced = false;
1870  bool free_mutex_flag = false;
1871  bool isdeadlock_timeout = false;
1872  int compat1, compat2;
1873  OID *oid_rr;
1874 
1875  /* Find the users that transaction is waiting for */
1876  waitfor_client_users = waitfor_client_users_default;
1877  nwaits = 0;
1878 
1879  assert (entry_ptr->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && entry_ptr->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1880 
1881  /* Dump all the tran. info. which this tran. is waiting for */
1882  res_ptr = entry_ptr->res_head;
1883  wait_for[0] = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1884 
1885  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
1886  free_mutex_flag = true;
1887  for (entry = res_ptr->holder; entry != NULL; entry = entry->next)
1888  {
1889  if (entry == entry_ptr)
1890  {
1891  continue;
1892  }
1893 
1894  assert (entry->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && entry->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1895  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry->granted_mode][entry_ptr->blocked_mode];
1896  compat2 = lock_Comp[entry->blocked_mode][entry_ptr->blocked_mode];
1897  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN && compat2 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1898 
1899  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO || compat2 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
1900  {
1901  EXPAND_WAIT_FOR_ARRAY_IF_NEEDED ();
1902  wait_for[nwaits++] = entry->tran_index;
1903  }
1904  }
1905 
1906  for (entry = res_ptr->waiter; entry != NULL; entry = entry->next)
1907  {
1908  if (entry == entry_ptr)
1909  {
1910  continue;
1911  }
1912 
1913  assert (entry->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && entry->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
1914  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry->blocked_mode][entry_ptr->blocked_mode];
1915  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
1916 
1917  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
1918  {
1919  EXPAND_WAIT_FOR_ARRAY_IF_NEEDED ();
1920  wait_for[nwaits++] = entry->tran_index;
1921  }
1922  }
1923 
1924  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
1925  free_mutex_flag = false;
1926 
1927  if (nwaits == 0 || (waitfor_client_users = (char *) malloc (unit_size * nwaits)) == NULL)
1928  {
1929  waitfor_client_users = waitfor_client_users_default;
1930  }
1931  else
1932  {
1933  for (ptr = waitfor_client_users, i = 0; i < nwaits; i++)
1934  {
1935  (void) logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (wait_for[i], &client_prog_name, &client_user_name, &client_host_name,
1936  &client_pid);
1937  n = sprintf (ptr, "%s%s@%s|%s(%d)", ((i == 0) ? "" : ", "), client_user_name, client_host_name,
1938  client_prog_name, client_pid);
1939  ptr += n;
1940  }
1941  }
1942 
1943 set_error:
1944 
1945  if (wait_for != wait_for_buf)
1946  {
1947  free_and_init (wait_for);
1948  }
1949 
1950  if (free_mutex_flag)
1951  {
1952  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
1953  free_mutex_flag = false;
1954  }
1955 
1956  /* get the client information of current transaction */
1957  (void) logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (entry_ptr->tran_index, &client_prog_name, &client_user_name,
1958  &client_host_name, &client_pid);
1959 
1960  if (entry_ptr->thrd_entry != NULL
1961  && ((entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_state == LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT)
1962  || (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_state == LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER)))
1963  {
1964  isdeadlock_timeout = true;
1965  }
1966 
1967  switch (entry_ptr->res_head->key.type)
1968  {
1969  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
1970  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
1971  oid_rr = oid_get_rep_read_tran_oid ();
1972  if (oid_rr != NULL && OID_EQ (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid, oid_rr))
1973  {
1974  classname = (char *) "Generic object for Repeatable Read consistency";
1975  is_classname_alloced = false;
1976  }
1977  else if (OID_ISTEMP (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid))
1978  {
1979  classname = NULL;
1980  }
1981  else
1982  {
1983  OID real_class_oid;
1984 
1985  if (entry_ptr->res_head->key.type == LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS
1986  && OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid))
1987  {
1988  OID_GET_REAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid, &real_class_oid);
1989  }
1990  else
1991  {
1992  COPY_OID (&real_class_oid, &entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid);
1993  }
1994  if (heap_get_class_name (thread_p, &real_class_oid, &classname) != NO_ERROR)
1995  {
1996  /* ignore */
1997  er_clear ();
1998  }
1999  else if (classname != NULL)
2000  {
2001  is_classname_alloced = true;
2002  }
2003  }
2004 
2005  if (classname != NULL)
2006  {
2007  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE,
2008  ((isdeadlock_timeout) ? ER_LK_OBJECT_DL_TIMEOUT_CLASS_MSG : ER_LK_OBJECT_TIMEOUT_CLASS_MSG), 7,
2009  entry_ptr->tran_index, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid,
2010  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry_ptr->blocked_mode), classname, waitfor_client_users);
2011  if (is_classname_alloced)
2012  {
2013  free_and_init (classname);
2014  }
2015  }
2016  else
2017  {
2018  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE,
2019  ((isdeadlock_timeout) ? ER_LK_OBJECT_DL_TIMEOUT_SIMPLE_MSG : ER_LK_OBJECT_TIMEOUT_SIMPLE_MSG), 9,
2020  entry_ptr->tran_index, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid,
2021  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry_ptr->blocked_mode), entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.volid,
2022  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.pageid, entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.slotid, waitfor_client_users);
2023  }
2024  break;
2025 
2026  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
2027  if (OID_ISTEMP (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.class_oid))
2028  {
2029  classname = NULL;
2030  }
2031  else
2032  {
2033  OID real_class_oid;
2034  if (OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.class_oid))
2035  {
2036  OID_GET_REAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&entry_ptr->res_head->key.class_oid, &real_class_oid);
2037  }
2038  else
2039  {
2040  COPY_OID (&real_class_oid, &entry_ptr->res_head->key.class_oid);
2041  }
2042  if (heap_get_class_name (thread_p, &real_class_oid, &classname) != NO_ERROR)
2043  {
2044  /* ignore */
2045  er_clear ();
2046  }
2047  }
2048 
2049  if (classname != NULL)
2050  {
2051  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE,
2052  ((isdeadlock_timeout) ? ER_LK_OBJECT_DL_TIMEOUT_CLASSOF_MSG : ER_LK_OBJECT_TIMEOUT_CLASSOF_MSG), 10,
2053  entry_ptr->tran_index, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid,
2054  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry_ptr->blocked_mode), entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.volid,
2055  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.pageid, entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.slotid, classname,
2056  waitfor_client_users);
2057  free_and_init (classname);
2058  }
2059  else
2060  {
2061  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE,
2062  ((isdeadlock_timeout) ? ER_LK_OBJECT_DL_TIMEOUT_SIMPLE_MSG : ER_LK_OBJECT_TIMEOUT_SIMPLE_MSG), 9,
2063  entry_ptr->tran_index, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid,
2064  LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry_ptr->blocked_mode), entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.volid,
2065  entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.pageid, entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid.slotid, waitfor_client_users);
2066  }
2067  break;
2068  default:
2069  break;
2070  }
2071 
2072  if (waitfor_client_users && waitfor_client_users != waitfor_client_users_default)
2073  {
2074  free_and_init (waitfor_client_users);
2075  }
2076 
2077  if (isdeadlock_timeout == false)
2078  {
2079  FILE *log_fp;
2080 
2081  log_fp = event_log_start (thread_p, "LOCK_TIMEOUT");
2082  if (log_fp == NULL)
2083  {
2084  return;
2085  }
2086 
2087  lock_event_log_blocked_lock (thread_p, log_fp, entry_ptr);
2088  lock_event_log_blocking_locks (thread_p, log_fp, entry_ptr);
2089 
2090  event_log_end (thread_p);
2091  }
2092 }
2093 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2094 
2095 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2096 /*
2097  * lock_set_tran_abort_reason - Set tran_abort_reason for the tran_index
2098  *
2099  * return: void
2100  * tran_index(in):
2101  * abort_reason(in):
2102  */
2103 static void
2104 lock_set_tran_abort_reason (int tran_index, TRAN_ABORT_REASON abort_reason)
2105 {
2106  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2107 
2108  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2109  assert (tdes != NULL);
2110 
2111  tdes->tran_abort_reason = abort_reason;
2112 }
2113 
2114 /*
2115  * lock_set_error_for_aborted - Set error for unilaterally aborted
2116  *
2117  * return:
2118  *
2119  * entry_ptr(in): pointer to the entry for waiting
2120  *
2121  * Note:set error code for unilaterally aborted deadlock victim
2122  */
2123 static void
2124 lock_set_error_for_aborted (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr)
2125 {
2126  char *client_prog_name; /* Client user name for transaction */
2127  char *client_user_name; /* Client user name for transaction */
2128  char *client_host_name; /* Client host for transaction */
2129  int client_pid; /* Client process id for transaction */
2130  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2131 
2132  (void) logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (entry_ptr->tran_index, &client_prog_name, &client_user_name,
2133  &client_host_name, &client_pid);
2134  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED, 4, entry_ptr->tran_index, client_user_name,
2135  client_host_name, client_pid);
2136 }
2137 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2138 
2139 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2140 /*
2141  * lock_suspend - Suspend current thread (transaction)
2142  *
2143  * return: LOCK_WAIT_STATE (state of resumption)
2144  *
2145  * entry_ptr(in): lock entry for lock waiting
2146  * wait_msecs(in): lock wait milliseconds
2147  */
2148 static LOCK_WAIT_STATE
2149 lock_suspend (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int wait_msecs)
2150 {
2151  THREAD_ENTRY *p;
2152  struct timeval tv;
2153  int client_id;
2154  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2155 
2156  /* The threads must not hold a page latch to be blocked on a lock request. */
2157  assert (lock_is_safe_lock_with_page (thread_p, entry_ptr) || !pgbuf_has_perm_pages_fixed (thread_p));
2158 
2159  /* The caller is holding the thread entry mutex */
2160 
2161  if (lk_Gl.verbose_mode)
2162  {
2163  char *__client_prog_name; /* Client program name for transaction */
2164  char *__client_user_name; /* Client user name for transaction */
2165  char *__client_host_name; /* Client host for transaction */
2166  int __client_pid; /* Client process id for transaction */
2167 
2168  fflush (stderr);
2169  fflush (stdout);
2170  logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (entry_ptr->tran_index, &__client_prog_name, &__client_user_name,
2171  &__client_host_name, &__client_pid);
2172  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_SUSPEND_TRAN),
2173  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->index, entry_ptr->tran_index, __client_prog_name, __client_user_name,
2174  __client_host_name, __client_pid);
2175  fflush (stdout);
2176  }
2177 
2178  /* register lock wait info. into the thread entry */
2179  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait = (void *) entry_ptr;
2180  gettimeofday (&tv, NULL);
2181  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime = (tv.tv_sec * 1000000LL + tv.tv_usec) / 1000LL;
2182  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_msecs = wait_msecs;
2183  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_state = (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED;
2184 
2185  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[entry_ptr->tran_index].thrd_wait_stime = entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime;
2186  lk_Gl.deadlock_and_timeout_detector++;
2187 
2188  tdes = LOG_FIND_CURRENT_TDES (thread_p);
2189 
2190  /* I must not be a deadlock-victim thread */
2191  assert (tdes->tran_abort_reason == TRAN_NORMAL);
2192 
2193  if (tdes)
2194  {
2195  tdes->waiting_for_res = entry_ptr->res_head;
2196  }
2197 
2198  lock_event_set_tran_wait_entry (entry_ptr->tran_index, entry_ptr);
2199 
2200  /* suspend the worker thread (transaction) */
2201  thread_suspend_wakeup_and_unlock_entry (entry_ptr->thrd_entry, THREAD_LOCK_SUSPENDED);
2202 
2203  lk_Gl.deadlock_and_timeout_detector--;
2204  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[entry_ptr->tran_index].thrd_wait_stime = 0;
2205 
2206  if (tdes)
2207  {
2208  tdes->waiting_for_res = NULL;
2209  }
2210 
2211  lock_event_set_tran_wait_entry (entry_ptr->tran_index, NULL);
2212 
2213  if (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->resume_status == THREAD_RESUME_DUE_TO_INTERRUPT)
2214  {
2215  /* a shutdown thread wakes me up */
2216  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTED, 0);
2217  return LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT;
2218  }
2219  else if (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->resume_status != THREAD_LOCK_RESUMED)
2220  {
2221  /* wake up with other reason */
2222  assert (false);
2223  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTED, 0);
2224  return LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT;
2225  }
2226  else
2227  {
2228  assert (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->resume_status == THREAD_LOCK_RESUMED);
2229  }
2230 
2231  thread_lock_entry (entry_ptr->thrd_entry);
2232  while (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->tran_next_wait)
2233  {
2234  p = entry_ptr->thrd_entry->tran_next_wait;
2235  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->tran_next_wait = p->tran_next_wait;
2236  p->tran_next_wait = NULL;
2237  thread_wakeup (p, THREAD_LOCK_RESUMED);
2238  }
2239  thread_unlock_entry (entry_ptr->thrd_entry);
2240 
2241  /* The thread has been awaken Before waking up the thread, the waker cleared the lockwait field of the thread entry
2242  * and set lockwait_state field of it to the resumed state while holding the thread entry mutex. After the wakeup, no
2243  * one can update the lockwait releated fields of the thread entry. Therefore, waken-up thread can read the values of
2244  * lockwait related fields of its own thread entry without holding thread entry mutex. */
2245 
2246  switch ((LOCK_WAIT_STATE) (entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_state))
2247  {
2248  case LOCK_RESUMED:
2249  /* The lock entry has already been moved to the holder list */
2250  return LOCK_RESUMED;
2251 
2252  case LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_FIRST:
2253  /* The lock entry does exist within the blocked holder list or blocked waiter list. Therefore, current thread
2254  * must disconnect it from the list. */
2255  if (logtb_is_current_active (thread_p))
2256  {
2257  /* set error code */
2258  lock_set_error_for_aborted (entry_ptr);
2259  lock_set_tran_abort_reason (entry_ptr->tran_index, TRAN_ABORT_DUE_DEADLOCK);
2260 
2261  /* wait until other threads finish their works A css_server_thread is always running for this transaction.
2262  * so, wait until css_count_transaction_worker_threads () becomes 1 (except me) */
2263  if (css_count_transaction_worker_threads (thread_p, entry_ptr->tran_index, css_get_client_id (thread_p)) >= 1)
2264  {
2265  logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt (thread_p, entry_ptr->tran_index, true);
2266  while (true)
2267  {
2268  thread_sleep (10); /* sleep 10 msec */
2269  logtb_wakeup_thread_with_tran_index (entry_ptr->tran_index, THREAD_RESUME_DUE_TO_INTERRUPT);
2270 
2271  client_id = css_get_client_id (thread_p);
2272  if (css_count_transaction_worker_threads (thread_p, entry_ptr->tran_index, client_id) == 0)
2273  {
2274  break;
2275  }
2276  }
2277  logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt (thread_p, entry_ptr->tran_index, false);
2278  }
2279  }
2280  else
2281  {
2282  /* We are already aborting, fall through. Don't do double aborts that could cause an infinite loop. */
2283  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_ABORT_TRAN_TWICE, 1, entry_ptr->tran_index);
2284  /* er_log_debug(ARG_FILE_LINE, "lk_suspend: Likely a system error. Trying to abort a transaction
2285  * twice.\n"); */
2286 
2287  /* Since we deadlocked during an abort, forcibly remove all page latches of this transaction and hope this
2288  * transaction is the cause of the logjam. We are hoping that this frees things just enough to let other
2289  * transactions continue. Note it is not be safe to unlock object locks this way. */
2290  pgbuf_unfix_all (thread_p);
2291  }
2292  return LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED;
2293 
2294  case LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER:
2295  /* The lock entry does exist within the blocked holder list or blocked waiter list. Therefore, current thread
2296  * must diconnect it from the list. */
2297  /* If two or more threads, which were executing for one transaction, are selected as deadlock victims, one of
2298  * them is charged of the transaction abortion and the other threads are notified of timeout. */
2299  (void) lock_set_error_for_timeout (thread_p, entry_ptr);
2300  return LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT;
2301 
2302  case LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT:
2303  (void) lock_set_error_for_timeout (thread_p, entry_ptr);
2304  return LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT;
2305 
2306  case LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT:
2307  /* The lock entry does exist within the blocked holder list or blocked waiter list. Therefore, current thread
2308  * must diconnect it from the list. An error is ONLY set when the caller was willing to wait.
2309  * entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_msecs > 0 */
2310  (void) lock_set_error_for_timeout (thread_p, entry_ptr);
2311  return LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT;
2312 
2313  case LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT:
2314  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTED, 0);
2315  return LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT;
2316 
2317  case LOCK_SUSPENDED:
2318  default:
2319  /* Probabely, the waiting structure has not been removed from the waiting hash table. May be a system error. */
2320  (void) lock_set_error_for_timeout (thread_p, entry_ptr);
2321  return LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT;
2322  }
2323 }
2324 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2325 
2326 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2327 /*
2328  * lk_resume - Resume the thread (transaction)
2329  *
2330  * return:
2331  *
2332  * entry_ptr(in):
2333  * state(in): resume state
2334  */
2335 static void
2336 lock_resume (LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr, int state)
2337 {
2338  /* The caller is holding the thread entry mutex */
2339  /* The caller has identified the fact that lockwait is not NULL. that is, the thread is suspended. */
2340  if (lk_Gl.verbose_mode == true)
2341  {
2342  char *__client_prog_name; /* Client program name for transaction */
2343  char *__client_user_name; /* Client user name for transaction */
2344  char *__client_host_name; /* Client host for transaction */
2345  int __client_pid; /* Client process id for transaction */
2346 
2347  fflush (stderr);
2348  fflush (stdout);
2349  (void) logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (entry_ptr->tran_index, &__client_prog_name, &__client_user_name,
2350  &__client_host_name, &__client_pid);
2351  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_RESUME_TRAN),
2352  entry_ptr->tran_index, entry_ptr->tran_index, __client_prog_name, __client_user_name, __client_host_name,
2353  __client_pid);
2354  fflush (stdout);
2355  }
2356 
2357  /* Before wake up the thread, clears lockwait field and set lockwait_state with the given state. */
2358  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait = NULL;
2359  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->lockwait_state = (int) state;
2360 
2361  /* wakes up the thread and release the thread entry mutex */
2362  entry_ptr->thrd_entry->resume_status = THREAD_LOCK_RESUMED;
2363  pthread_cond_signal (&entry_ptr->thrd_entry->wakeup_cond);
2364  thread_unlock_entry (entry_ptr->thrd_entry);
2365 }
2366 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2367 
2368 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2369 /*
2370  * lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout - Wake up the deadlock victim while notifying timeout
2371  *
2372  * return: true if the transaction is treated as deadlock victim or
2373  * false if the transaction is not treated as deadlock victim.
2374  * in this case, the transaction has already been waken up
2375  * by other threads with other purposes(ex. lock is granted)
2376  *
2377  * tran_index(in): deadlock victim transaction
2378  *
2379  * Note:The given transaction was selected as a deadlock victim in the last
2380  * deadlock detection. The deadlock victim is waked up and noitified of
2381  * timeout by this function if the deadlock victim is still suspended.
2382  */
2383 static bool
2384 lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout (int tran_index)
2385 {
2386  tran_lock_waiters_array_type tran_lock_waiters;
2387  THREAD_ENTRY **thrd_array;
2388  size_t thrd_count, i;
2389  THREAD_ENTRY *thrd_ptr;
2390  bool wakeup_first = false;
2391 
2392  thrd_count = 0;
2393  lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads (tran_index, tran_lock_waiters, thrd_count);
2394  thrd_array = tran_lock_waiters.data ();
2395 
2396  for (i = 0; i < thrd_count; i++)
2397  {
2398  thrd_ptr = thrd_array[i];
2399  thread_lock_entry (thrd_ptr);
2400  if (thrd_ptr->tran_index == tran_index && LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD (thrd_ptr))
2401  {
2402  /* wake up the thread while notifying timeout */
2403  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd_ptr->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT);
2404  wakeup_first = true;
2405  }
2406  else
2407  {
2408  if (thrd_ptr->lockwait != NULL || thrd_ptr->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
2409  {
2410  /* some strange lock wait state.. */
2411  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_STRANGE_LOCK_WAIT, 5, thrd_ptr->lockwait,
2412  thrd_ptr->lockwait_state, thrd_ptr->index, thrd_ptr->get_posix_id (), thrd_ptr->tran_index);
2413  }
2414  /* The current thread has already been waken up by other threads. The current thread might be granted the
2415  * lock. or with any other reason....... even if it is a thread of the deadlock victim. */
2416  /* release the thread entry mutex */
2417  thread_unlock_entry (thrd_ptr);
2418  }
2419  }
2420  return wakeup_first;
2421 }
2422 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2423 
2424 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2425 /*
2426  * lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted - Wake up the deadlock victim while notifying aborted
2427  *
2428  * return: true if the transaction is treated as deadlock victim or
2429  * false if the transaction is not treated as deadlock victim.
2430  * in this case, the transaction has already been waken up
2431  * by other threads with other purposes(ex. lock is granted)
2432  *
2433  * tran_index(in): deadlock victim transaction
2434  *
2435  * Note:The given transaction was selected as a deadlock victim in the last
2436  * deadlock detection. The deadlock victim is waked up and noitified of
2437  * abortion by this function if the deadlock victim is still suspended.
2438  */
2439 static bool
2440 lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted (int tran_index)
2441 {
2442  tran_lock_waiters_array_type tran_lock_waiters;
2443  THREAD_ENTRY **thrd_array;
2444  size_t thrd_count, i;
2445  THREAD_ENTRY *thrd_ptr;
2446  bool wakeup_first = false;
2447 
2448  thrd_count = 0;
2449  lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads (tran_index, tran_lock_waiters, thrd_count);
2450  thrd_array = tran_lock_waiters.data ();
2451 
2452  for (i = 0; i < thrd_count; i++)
2453  {
2454  thrd_ptr = thrd_array[i];
2455  thread_lock_entry (thrd_ptr);
2456  if (thrd_ptr->tran_index == tran_index && LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD (thrd_ptr))
2457  {
2458  /* wake up the thread while notifying deadlock victim */
2459  if (wakeup_first == false)
2460  {
2461  /* The current transaction is really aborted. Therefore, other threads of the current transaction must
2462  * quit their executions and return to client. Then the first waken-up thread must be charge of the
2463  * rollback of the current transaction. */
2464  /* set the transaction as deadlock victim */
2465  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[tran_index].DL_victim = true;
2466  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd_ptr->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_FIRST);
2467  wakeup_first = true;
2468  }
2469  else
2470  {
2471  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd_ptr->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER);
2472  }
2473  }
2474  else
2475  {
2476  if (thrd_ptr->lockwait != NULL || thrd_ptr->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
2477  {
