7504  if (tran_lock->root_class_hold != NULL || tran_lock->class_hold_list != NULL || tran_lock->inst_hold_list != NULL
7505  || tran_lock->non2pl_list != NULL)
7506  {
7507  lock_hold = true;
7508  }
7509  else
7510  {
7511  lock_hold = false;
7512  }
7513  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
7514 
7515  return lock_hold;
7516 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
7517 }
7518 #endif
7519 
7520 /*
7521  * lock_is_waiting_transaction -
7522  *
7523  * return:
7524  *
7525  * tran_index(in):
7526  */
7527 bool
7528 lock_is_waiting_transaction (int tran_index)
7529 {
7530 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
7531  return false;
7532 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7533  tran_lock_waiters_array_type tran_lock_waiters;
7534  THREAD_ENTRY **thrd_array;
7535  size_t thrd_count, i;
7536  THREAD_ENTRY *thrd_ptr;
7537 
7538  thrd_count = 0;
7539  lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads (tran_index, tran_lock_waiters, thrd_count);
7540  thrd_array = tran_lock_waiters.data ();
7541 
7542  for (i = 0; i < thrd_count; i++)
7543  {
7544  thrd_ptr = thrd_array[i];
7545  thread_lock_entry (thrd_ptr);
7546  if (LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD (thrd_ptr))
7547  {
7548  thread_unlock_entry (thrd_ptr);
7549  return true;
7550  }
7551  else
7552  {
7553  if (thrd_ptr->lockwait != NULL || thrd_ptr->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
7554  {
7555  /* some strange lock wait state.. */
7556  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_STRANGE_LOCK_WAIT, 5, thrd_ptr->lockwait,
7557  thrd_ptr->lockwait_state, thrd_ptr->index, thrd_ptr->get_posix_id (), thrd_ptr->tran_index);
7558  }
7559  }
7560  thread_unlock_entry (thrd_ptr);
7561  }
7562 
7563  return false;
7564 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
7565 }
7566 
7567 /*
7568  * lock_get_class_lock - Get a pointer to lock heap entry acquired by
7569  * given transaction on given class object
7570  *
7571  * return:
7572  *
7573  * class_oid(in): target class object identifier
7574  * tran_index(in): target transaction
7575  *
7576  * Note:This function finds lock entry acquired by the given transaction
7577  * on the given class and then return a pointer to the lock entry.
7578  */
7579 LK_ENTRY *
7580 lock_get_class_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const OID * class_oid, int tran_index)
7581 {
7582 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
7583  assert (false);
7584 
7585  return NULL;
7586 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7587  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
7588  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr;
7589  int rv;
7590 
7591  if (class_oid == NULL)
7592  {
7593  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_BAD_ARGUMENT, 2, "lk_get_class_lock_ptr",
7594  "NULL ClassOID pointer");
7595  return NULL;
7596  }
7597  if (OID_ISNULL (class_oid))
7598  {
7599  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_BAD_ARGUMENT, 2, "lk_get_class_lock_ptr", "NULL_ClassOID");
7600  return NULL;
7601  }
7602 
7603  /* get a pointer to transaction lock info entry */
7604  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
7605 
7606  /* case 1: root class lock */
7607  if (OID_EQ (class_oid, oid_Root_class_oid))
7608  {
7609  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
7610  entry_ptr = tran_lock->root_class_hold;
7611  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
7612  }
7613  else
7614  {
7615  entry_ptr = lock_find_tran_hold_entry (thread_p, tran_index, class_oid, true);
7616  }
7617 
7618  return entry_ptr;
7619 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
7620 }
7621 
7622 void
7623 lock_force_thread_timeout_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thrd)
7624 {
7625 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
7626  thread_lock_entry (thrd);
7627  if (LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD (thrd))
7628  {
7629  /* wake up the thread */
7630  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT);
7631  }
7632  else
7633  {
7634  if (thrd->lockwait != NULL || thrd->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
7635  {
7636  /* some strange lock wait state.. */
7637  assert (false);
7638  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_STRANGE_LOCK_WAIT, 5, thrd->lockwait,
7639  thrd->lockwait_state, thrd->index, thrd->get_posix_id (), thrd->tran_index);
7640  }
7641  /* release the thread entry mutex */
7642  thread_unlock_entry (thrd);
7643  }
7644 #endif // SERVER_MODE
7645 }
7646 
7647 /*
7648  * lock_force_timeout_expired_wait_transactions - Transaction is timeout if its waiting time has
7649  * expired or it is interrupted
7650  *
7651  * return: true if the thread was timed out or
7652  * false if the thread was not timed out.
7653  *
7654  * thrd_entry(in): thread entry pointer
7655  *
7656  * Note:If the given thread is waiting on a lock to be granted, and
7657  * either its expiration time has expired or it is interrupted,
7658  * the thread is timed-out.
7659  * If NULL is given, it applies to all threads.
7660  */
7661 static bool
7662 lock_force_timeout_expired_wait_transactions (void *thrd_entry)
7663 {
7664 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
7665  return true;
7666 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7667  bool ignore;
7668  THREAD_ENTRY *thrd;
7669 
7670  assert (thrd_entry != NULL);
7671 
7672  thrd = (THREAD_ENTRY *) thrd_entry;
7673 
7674  thread_lock_entry (thrd);
7675  if (LK_IS_LOCKWAIT_THREAD (thrd))
7676  {
7677  if (logtb_is_interrupted_tran (thrd, true, &ignore, thrd->tran_index))
7678  {
7679  /* wake up the thread */
7680  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT);
7681  return true;
7682  }
7683  else if (LK_CAN_TIMEOUT (thrd->lockwait_msecs))
7684  {
7685  struct timeval tv;
7686  INT64 etime;
7687 
7688  (void) gettimeofday (&tv, NULL);
7689  etime = (tv.tv_sec * 1000000LL + tv.tv_usec) / 1000LL;
7690  if (etime - thrd->lockwait_stime > thrd->lockwait_msecs)
7691  {
7692  /* wake up the thread */
7693  lock_resume ((LK_ENTRY *) thrd->lockwait, LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT);
7694  return true;
7695  }
7696  }
7697 
7698  /* release the thread entry mutex */
7699  thread_unlock_entry (thrd);
7700  return false;
7701  }
7702  else
7703  {
7704  if (thrd->lockwait != NULL || thrd->lockwait_state == (int) LOCK_SUSPENDED)
7705  {
7706  /* some strange lock wait state.. */
7707  assert (false);
7708  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_STRANGE_LOCK_WAIT, 5, thrd->lockwait,
7709  thrd->lockwait_state, thrd->index, thrd->get_posix_id (), thrd->tran_index);
7710  }
7711 
7712  /* release the thread entry mutex */
7713  thread_unlock_entry (thrd);
7714  return false;
7715  }
7716 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
7717 }
7718 
7719 /*
7720  * lock_notify_isolation_incons - Notify of possible inconsistencies (no
7721  * repeatable reads) due to transaction isolation
7722  * level
7723  *
7724  * return: nothing.
7725  *
7726  * fun(in): Function to notify
7727  * args(in): Extra arguments for function
7728  *
7729  * Note:The current transaction is notified of any possible
7730  * inconsistencies due to its isolation level. For each possible
7731  * inconsistency the given function is called to decache any
7732  * copies of the object.
7733  */
7734 void
7735 lock_notify_isolation_incons (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool (*fun) (const OID * class_oid, const OID * oid, void *args),
7736  void *args)
7737 {
7738 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
7739  return;
7740 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7741  TRAN_ISOLATION isolation;
7742  int tran_index;
7743  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
7744  LK_ENTRY *curr, *prev, *next;
7745  LK_ENTRY *incon_non2pl_list_header = NULL;
7746  LK_ENTRY *incon_non2pl_list_tail = NULL;
7747  bool ret_val;
7748  int rv;
7749 
7750  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
7751  isolation = logtb_find_isolation (tran_index);
7752  if (isolation == TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ || isolation == TRAN_SERIALIZABLE)
7753  {
7754  return; /* Nothing was released */
7755  }
7756 
7757  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
7758  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
7759 
7760  prev = NULL;
7761  curr = tran_lock->non2pl_list;
7762  while (tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl > 0 && curr != NULL)
7763  {
7764  if (curr->granted_mode != INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK)
7765  {
7766  prev = curr;
7767  curr = curr->tran_next;
7768  continue;
7769  }
7770 
7771  /* curr->granted_mode == INCON_NON_TWO_PHASE_LOCK */
7772  assert (curr->res_head->key.type != LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE || !OID_ISNULL (&curr->res_head->key.class_oid));
7773 
7774  ret_val = (*fun) (&curr->res_head->key.class_oid, &curr->res_head->key.oid, args);
7775  if (ret_val != true)
7776  {
7777  /* the notification area is full */
7778  pthread_mutex_unlock (&(tran_lock->non2pl_mutex));
7779 
7780  goto end;
7781  }
7782 
7783  /* the non-2pl entry should be freed. */
7784  /* 1. remove it from transaction non2pl list */
7785  next = curr->tran_next;
7786  if (prev == NULL)
7787  {
7788  tran_lock->non2pl_list = next;
7789  }
7790  else
7791  {
7792  prev->tran_next = next;
7793  }
7794 
7795  tran_lock->num_incons_non2pl -= 1;
7796 
7797  /* 2. append current entry to incon_non2pl_list */
7798  curr->tran_next = NULL;
7799  if (incon_non2pl_list_header == NULL)
7800  {
7801  incon_non2pl_list_header = curr;
7802  incon_non2pl_list_tail = curr;
7803  }
7804  else
7805  {
7806  incon_non2pl_list_tail->tran_next = curr;
7807  incon_non2pl_list_tail = curr;
7808  }
7809 
7810  curr = next;
7811  }
7812 
7813  /* release transaction non2pl mutex */
7814  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->non2pl_mutex);
7815 
7816 end:
7817 
7818  curr = incon_non2pl_list_header;
7819  while (curr != NULL)
7820  {
7821  next = curr->tran_next;
7822 
7823  /* remove it from resource non2pl list and free it */
7824  lock_remove_non2pl (thread_p, curr, tran_index);
7825 
7826  curr = next;
7827  }
7828 
7829  return;
7830 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
7831 }
7832 
7833 /*
7834  * lock_is_local_deadlock_detection_interval_up - Check local deadlock detection interval
7835  *
7836  * return:
7837  *
7838  * Note:check if the local deadlock detection should be performed.
7839  */
7840 static bool
7841 lock_is_local_deadlock_detection_interval_up (void)
7842 {
7843 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
7844  struct timeval now, elapsed;
7845  double elapsed_sec;
7846 
7847  /* check deadlock detection interval */
7848  gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
7849  perfmon_diff_timeval (&elapsed, &lk_Gl.last_deadlock_run, &now);
7850  elapsed_sec = elapsed.tv_sec + (elapsed.tv_usec / 1000000.0);
7851 
7852  if (elapsed_sec < prm_get_float_value (PRM_ID_LK_RUN_DEADLOCK_INTERVAL))
7853  {
7854  return false;
7855  }
7856 
7857  /* update the last deadlock run time */
7858  lk_Gl.last_deadlock_run = now;
7859 
7860  return true;
7861 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7862  return false;
7863 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
7864 }
7865 
7866 //
7867 // lock_victimize_first_thread_mapfunc - map function on all entries until one lock waiter is victimized
7868 //
7869 // thread_ref (in) : current thread
7870 // stop_mapper (in) : output to stop mapper when a thread was victimized
7871 //
7872 static void
7873 lock_victimize_first_thread_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper)
7874 {
7875 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
7876  if (thread_ref.lockwait == NULL)
7877  {
7878  return;
7879  }
7880  int tran_index = thread_ref.tran_index;
7881  if (lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout (tran_index))
7882  {
7883  stop_mapper = true;
7884  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_NOTENOUGH_ACTIVE_THREADS, 3,
7885  (int) css_get_num_request_workers (), logtb_get_number_assigned_tran_indices (), tran_index);
7886  }
7887 #endif // SERVER_MODE
7888 }
7889 
7890 /*
7891  * lock_detect_local_deadlock - Run the local deadlock detection
7892  *
7893  * return: nothing
7894  *
7895  * Note:Run the deadlock detection. For every cycle either timeout or
7896  * abort a transaction. The timeout option is always preferred over
7897  * the unilaterally abort option. When the unilaterally abort option
7898  * is exercised, the youngest transaction in the cycle is selected.
7899  * The youngest transaction is hopefully the one that has done less work.
7900  *
7901  * First, allocate heaps for WFG table from local memory.
7902  * Check whether deadlock(s) have been occurred or not.
7903  *
7904  * Deadlock detection is performed via exhaustive loop construction
7905  * which indicates the wait-for-relationship.
7906  * If deadlock is detected,
7907  * the first transaction which enables a cycle
7908  * when scanning from the first of object lock table to the last of it.
7909  *
7910  * The deadlock of victims are waken up and aborted by themselves.
7911  *
7912  * Last, free WFG framework.
7913  */
7914 static void
7915 lock_detect_local_deadlock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
7916 {
7917 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
7918  return;
7919 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
7920  LF_HASH_TABLE_ITERATOR iterator;
7921  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_OBJ_LOCK_RES);
7922  int k, s, t;
7923  LK_RES *res_ptr;
7924  LK_ENTRY *hi, *hj;
7925  LK_WFG_NODE *TWFG_node;
7926  LK_WFG_EDGE *TWFG_edge;
7927  int i, rv;
7928  LOCK_COMPATIBILITY compat1, compat2;
7929  int tran_index;
7930  FILE *log_fp;
7931 
7932  /* initialize deadlock detection related structures */
7933 
7934  /* initialize transaction WFG node table.. The current transaction might be old deadlock victim. And, the transaction
7935  * may have not been aborted, until now. Even if the transaction(old deadlock victim) has not been aborted, set
7936  * checked_by_deadlock_detector of the transaction to true. */
7937  for (i = 1; i < lk_Gl.num_trans; i++)
7938  {
7939  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].first_edge = -1;
7940  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].tran_edge_seq_num = 0;
7941  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[i].checked_by_deadlock_detector = true;
7942  }
7943 
7944  /* initialize transaction WFG edge table */
7945  lk_Gl.TWFG_edge = &TWFG_edge_block[0];
7946  lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge = LK_MIN_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT; /* initial value */
7947  for (i = 0; i < LK_MIN_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT; i++)
7948  {
7949  lk_Gl.TWFG_edge[i].to_tran_index = -1;
7950  lk_Gl.TWFG_edge[i].next = (i + 1);
7951  }
7952  lk_Gl.TWFG_edge[lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge - 1].next = -1;
7953  lk_Gl.TWFG_free_edge_idx = 0;
7954 
7955  /* initialize global_edge_seq_num */
7956  lk_Gl.global_edge_seq_num = 0;
7957 
7958  /* initialize victim count */
7959  victim_count = 0; /* used as index of victims array */
7960 
7961  /* hold the deadlock detection mutex */
7962  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&lk_Gl.DL_detection_mutex);
7963 
7964  lf_hash_create_iterator (&iterator, t_entry, &lk_Gl.obj_hash_table);
7965  res_ptr = (LK_RES *) lf_hash_iterate (&iterator);
7966 
7967  for (; res_ptr != NULL; res_ptr = (LK_RES *) lf_hash_iterate (&iterator))
7968  {
7969  /* holding resource mutex */
7970  if (res_ptr->holder == NULL)
7971  {
7972  if (res_ptr->waiter == NULL)
7973  {
7974  continue;
7975  }
7976  else
7977  {
7978 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7979  FILE *lk_fp;
7980  time_t cur_time;
7981  char time_val[CTIME_MAX];
7982 
7983  lk_fp = fopen ("lock_waiter_only_info.log", "a");
7984  if (lk_fp != NULL)
7985  {
7986  cur_time = time (NULL);
7987  (void) ctime_r (&cur_time, time_val);
7988  fprintf (lk_fp, "##########################################\n");
7989  fprintf (lk_fp, "# current time: %s\n", time_val);
7990  lock_dump_resource (lk_fp, res_ptr);
7991  fprintf (lk_fp, "##########################################\n");
7992  fclose (lk_fp);
7993  }
7994 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7995  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_LOCK_WAITER_ONLY, 1, "lock_waiter_only_info.log");
7996 
7997  if (res_ptr->total_holders_mode != NULL_LOCK)
7998  {
7999  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_TOTAL_HOLDERS_MODE, 1, res_ptr->total_holders_mode);
8000  res_ptr->total_holders_mode = NULL_LOCK;
8001  }
8002  (void) lock_grant_blocked_waiter (thread_p, res_ptr);
8003  }
8004  }
8005 
8006  /* among holders */
8007  for (hi = res_ptr->holder; hi != NULL; hi = hi->next)
8008  {
8009  if (hi->blocked_mode == NULL_LOCK)
8010  {
8011  break;
8012  }
8013  for (hj = hi->next; hj != NULL; hj = hj->next)
8014  {
8015  assert (hi->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && hi->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
8016  assert (hj->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && hj->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
8017 
8018  compat1 = lock_Comp[hj->blocked_mode][hi->granted_mode];
8019  compat2 = lock_Comp[hj->blocked_mode][hi->blocked_mode];
8020  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN && compat2 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
8021 
8022  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO || compat2 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
8023  {
8024  (void) lock_add_WFG_edge (hj->tran_index, hi->tran_index, true, hj->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime);
8025  }
8026 
8027  compat1 = lock_Comp[hi->blocked_mode][hj->granted_mode];
8028  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
8029 
8030  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
8031  {
8032  (void) lock_add_WFG_edge (hi->tran_index, hj->tran_index, true, hi->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime);
8033  }
8034  }
8035  }
8036 
8037  /* from waiters in the waiter to holders */
8038  for (hi = res_ptr->holder; hi != NULL; hi = hi->next)
8039  {
8040  for (hj = res_ptr->waiter; hj != NULL; hj = hj->next)
8041  {
8042  assert (hi->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && hi->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
8043  assert (hj->granted_mode >= NULL_LOCK && hj->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
8044 
8045  compat1 = lock_Comp[hj->blocked_mode][hi->granted_mode];
8046  compat2 = lock_Comp[hj->blocked_mode][hi->blocked_mode];
8047  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN && compat2 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
8048 
8049  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO || compat2 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
8050  {
8051  (void) lock_add_WFG_edge (hj->tran_index, hi->tran_index, true, hj->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime);
8052  }
8053  }
8054  }
8055 
8056  /* from waiters in the waiter to other waiters in the waiter */
8057  for (hi = res_ptr->waiter; hi != NULL; hi = hi->next)
8058  {
8059  for (hj = hi->next; hj != NULL; hj = hj->next)
8060  {
8061  assert (hj->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK && hi->blocked_mode >= NULL_LOCK);
8062 
8063  compat1 = lock_Comp[hj->blocked_mode][hi->blocked_mode];
8064  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
8065 
8066  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
8067  {
8068  (void) lock_add_WFG_edge (hj->tran_index, hi->tran_index, false, hj->thrd_entry->lockwait_stime);
8069  }
8070  }
8071  }
8072  }
8073 
8074  /* release DL detection mutex */
8075  pthread_mutex_unlock (&lk_Gl.DL_detection_mutex);
8076 
8077  /* simple notation for using in the following statements */
8078  TWFG_node = lk_Gl.TWFG_node;
8079  TWFG_edge = lk_Gl.TWFG_edge;
8080 
8081  /*
8082  * deadlock detection and victim selection
8083  */
8084 
8085  for (k = 1; k < lk_Gl.num_trans; k++)
8086  {
8087  TWFG_node[k].current = TWFG_node[k].first_edge;
8088  TWFG_node[k].ancestor = -1;
8089  }
8090  for (k = 1; k < lk_Gl.num_trans; k++)
8091  {
8092  if (TWFG_node[k].current == -1)
8093  {
8094  continue;
8095  }
8096  s = k;
8097  TWFG_node[s].ancestor = -2;
8098  for (; s != -2;)
8099  {
8100  if (TWFG_node[s].checked_by_deadlock_detector == false || TWFG_node[s].thrd_wait_stime == 0
8101  || (TWFG_node[s].current != -1
8102  && (TWFG_node[s].thrd_wait_stime > TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].edge_wait_stime)))
8103  {
8104  /* A new transaction started */
8105  TWFG_node[s].first_edge = -1;
8106  TWFG_node[s].current = -1;
8107  }
8108 
8109  if (TWFG_node[s].current == -1)
8110  {
8111  t = TWFG_node[s].ancestor;
8112  TWFG_node[s].ancestor = -1;
8113  s = t;
8114  if (s != -2 && TWFG_node[s].current != -1)
8115  {
8116  assert_release (TWFG_node[s].current >= 0 && TWFG_node[s].current < lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge);
8117  TWFG_node[s].current = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].next;
8118  }
8119  continue;
8120  }
8121 
8122  assert_release (TWFG_node[s].current >= 0 && TWFG_node[s].current < lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge);
8123 
8124  t = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].to_tran_index;
8125 
8126  if (t == -2)
8127  { /* old WFG edge */
8128  TWFG_node[s].current = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].next;
8129  continue;
8130  }
8131 
8132  if (TWFG_node[t].current == -1)
8133  {
8134  TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].to_tran_index = -2;
8135  TWFG_node[s].current = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].next;
8136  continue;
8137  }
8138 
8139  if (TWFG_node[t].checked_by_deadlock_detector == false || TWFG_node[t].thrd_wait_stime == 0
8140  || TWFG_node[t].thrd_wait_stime > TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[t].current].edge_wait_stime)
8141  {
8142  TWFG_node[t].first_edge = -1;
8143  TWFG_node[t].current = -1;
8144  TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].to_tran_index = -2;
8145  TWFG_node[s].current = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].next;
8146  continue;
8147  }
8148 
8149  if (TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].edge_seq_num < TWFG_node[t].tran_edge_seq_num)
8150  { /* old WFG edge */
8151  TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].to_tran_index = -2;
8152  TWFG_node[s].current = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].next;
8153  continue;
8154  }
8155 
8156  if (TWFG_node[t].ancestor != -1)
8157  {
8158  /* A deadlock cycle is found */
8159  lock_select_deadlock_victim (thread_p, s, t);
8160  if (victim_count >= LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT)
8161  {
8162  goto final_;
8163  }
8164  }
8165  else
8166  {
8167  TWFG_node[t].ancestor = s;
8168  TWFG_node[t].candidate = TWFG_edge[TWFG_node[s].current].holder_flag;
8169  }
8170  s = t;
8171  }
8172  }
8173 
8174 final_:
8175 
8176 #if defined(ENABLE_SYSTEMTAP)
8177  if (victim_count > 0)
8178  {
8179  CUBRID_TRAN_DEADLOCK ();
8180  }
8181 #endif /* ENABLE_SYSTEMTAP */
8182 
8183 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
8184  if (victim_count > 0)
8185  {
8186  size_t size_loc;
8187  char *ptr;
8188  FILE *fp = port_open_memstream (&ptr, &size_loc);
8189 
8190  if (fp)
8191  {
8192  lock_dump_deadlock_victims (thread_p, fp);
8193  port_close_memstream (fp, &ptr, &size_loc);
8194 
8195  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_DEADLOCK_SPECIFIC_INFO, 1, ptr);
8196 
8197  if (ptr != NULL)
8198  {
8199  free (ptr);
8200  }
8201  }
8202  }
8203 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
8204 
8205  /* dump deadlock cycle to event log file */
8206  for (k = 0; k < victim_count; k++)
8207  {
8208  if (victims[k].tran_index_in_cycle == NULL)
8209  {
8210  continue;
8211  }
8212 
8213  log_fp = event_log_start (thread_p, "DEADLOCK");
8214  if (log_fp != NULL)
8215  {
8216  for (i = 0; i < victims[k].num_trans_in_cycle; i++)
8217  {
8218  tran_index = victims[k].tran_index_in_cycle[i];
8219  event_log_print_client_info (tran_index, 0);
8220  lock_event_log_tran_locks (thread_p, log_fp, tran_index);
8221  }
8222 
8223  event_log_end (thread_p);
8224  }
8225 
8226  free_and_init (victims[k].tran_index_in_cycle);
8227  }
8228 
8229  /* Now solve the deadlocks (cycles) by executing the cycle resolution function (e.g., aborting victim) */
8230  for (k = 0; k < victim_count; k++)
8231  {
8232  if (victims[k].can_timeout)
8233  {
8234  (void) lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout (victims[k].tran_index);
8235  }
8236  else
8237  {
8238  (void) lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted (victims[k].tran_index);
8239  }
8240  }
8241 
8242  /* deallocate memory space used for deadlock detection */
8243  if (lk_Gl.max_TWFG_edge > LK_MID_TWFG_EDGE_COUNT)
8244  {
8245  free_and_init (lk_Gl.TWFG_edge);
8246  }
8247 
8248  if (victim_count == 0)
8249  {
8250  if (lk_Gl.no_victim_case_count < 60)
8251  {
8252  lk_Gl.no_victim_case_count += 1;
8253  }
8254  else
8255  {
8256  /* Make sure that we have threads available for another client to execute, otherwise Panic... */
8257  if (css_are_all_request_handlers_suspended ())
8258  {
8259  /* We must timeout at least one thread, so other clients can execute, otherwise, the server will hang. */
8260  thread_get_manager ()->map_entries (lock_victimize_first_thread_mapfunc);
8261  }
8262  lk_Gl.no_victim_case_count = 0;
8263  }
8264  }
8265 
8266  return;
8267 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8268 }
8269 
8270 #if 0 /* NOT_USED */
8271 /*
8272  */
8273 
8274 /*
8275  * lk_global_deadlock_detection: RUN THE GLOBAL DEADLOCK DETECTION
8276  * arguments:
8277  * returns/side-effects: nothing
8278  * Note: Run the deadlock detection. For every cycle either timeout or
8279  * abort a transaction. The timeout option is always preferred
8280  * over the unilaterally abort option. When the unilaterally
8281  * abort option is exercised, the youngest transaction in the
8282  * cycle is selected. The youngest transaction is hopefully the
8283  * one that has done less work.
8284  */
8285 void
8286 lk_global_deadlock_detection (void)
8287 {
8288 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8289  return;
8290 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8291  int i, j;
8292  WFG_CYCLE *cycles, *cur_cycle;
8293  WFG_CYCLE_CASE cycle_case;
8294  int num_victims;
8295  int tot_num_victims = 0;
8296  LK_DEADLOCK_VICTIM victims[LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT];
8297  LK_DEADLOCK_VICTIM *v_p;
8298  int tran_index;
8299  TRANID tranid;
8300  int can_timeout;
8301  int already_picked;
8302  int ok;
8303  int error;
8304  bool isvictim_tg_waiting;
8305  bool iscandidate_tg_waiting;
8306 
8307  /* 1. Find all the cycles that are currently involved in the system */
8308  cycle_case = WFG_CYCLE_YES_PRUNE;
8309  while (cycle_case == WFG_CYCLE_YES_PRUNE)
8310  {
8311  error = wfg_detect_cycle (&cycle_case, &cycles);
8312 
8313  if (error == NO_ERROR && (cycle_case == WFG_CYCLE_YES_PRUNE || cycle_case == WFG_CYCLE_YES))
8314  {
8315  /* There are deadlocks, we must select a victim for each cycle. We try to break a cycle by timing out a
8316  * transaction whenever is possible. In any other case, we select a victim for an unilaterally abort. */
8317  num_victims = 0;
8318  for (cur_cycle = cycles; cur_cycle != NULL && num_victims < LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT; cur_cycle = cur_cycle->next)
8319  {
8320  victims[num_victims].tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
8321  victims[num_victims].can_timeout = false;
8322  already_picked = false;
8323 
8324  /* Pick a victim for next cycle */
8325  for (i = 0; i < cur_cycle->num_trans && already_picked == false; i++)
8326  {
8327  tran_index = cur_cycle->waiters[i].tran_index;
8328  for (j = 0; j < num_victims; j++)
8329  {
8330  if (tran_index == victims[j].tran_index)
8331  {
8332  /* A victim for this cycle has already been picked. The index is part of another cycle */
8333  already_picked = true;
8334  break;
8335  }
8336  }
8337  if (already_picked != true)
8338  {
8339  tranid = logtb_find_tranid (tran_index);
8340  can_timeout = LK_CAN_TIMEOUT (logtb_find_wait_msecs (tran_index));
8341  /* Victim selection: 1) Avoid unactive transactions. 2) Prefer a waiter of TG resources. 3)
8342  * Prefer a transaction with a closer tiemout. 4) Prefer the youngest transaction. */
8343  /* Have we selected a victim or the currently victim is inactive (i.e., in rollback or commit
8344  * process), select the new candidate as the victim. */
8345  ok = 0;
8346 
8347  /*
8348  * never consider the unactive one as a victim
8349  */
8350  if (logtb_is_active (tranid) == false)
8351  continue;
8352 
8353  if (victims[num_victims].tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX
8354  || (logtb_is_active (victims[num_victims].tranid) == false
8355  && logtb_is_active (tranid) != false))
8356  {
8357  ok = 1;
8358  }
8359  else
8360  {
8361  isvictim_tg_waiting = wfg_is_tran_group_waiting (victims[num_victims].tran_index);
8362 
8363  iscandidate_tg_waiting = wfg_is_tran_group_waiting (tran_index);
8364 
8365  if (isvictim_tg_waiting != NO_ERROR)
8366  {
8367  if (iscandidate_tg_waiting == NO_ERROR
8368  || (victims[num_victims].can_timeout == false && can_timeout == true)
8369  || (victims[num_victims].can_timeout == can_timeout
8370  && LK_ISYOUNGER (tranid, victims[num_victims].tranid)))
8371  {
8372  ok = 1;
8373  }
8374  }
8375  else
8376  {
8377  if (iscandidate_tg_waiting == NO_ERROR
8378  && ((victims[num_victims].can_timeout == false && can_timeout == true)
8379  || (victims[num_victims].can_timeout == can_timeout
8380  && LK_ISYOUNGER (tranid, victims[num_victims].tranid))))
8381  {
8382  ok = 1;
8383  }
8384  }
8385  }
8386 
8387  if (ok == 1)
8388  {
8389  victims[num_victims].tran_index = tran_index;
8390  victims[num_victims].tranid = tranid;
8391  victims[num_victims].can_timeout = can_timeout;
8392  victims[num_victims].cycle_fun = cur_cycle->waiters[i].cycle_fun;
8393  victims[num_victims].args = cur_cycle->waiters[i].args;
8394  }
8395  }
8396  }
8397  if (already_picked != true && victims[num_victims].tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
8398  {
8399  num_victims++;
8400  }
8401  }
8402 
8403  /* Now, solve the deadlocks (cycles) by executing the cycle resolution function (e.g., aborting victim) */
8404  for (i = 0; i < num_victims; i++)
8405  {
8406  *v_p = victims[i];
8407  if (v_p->cycle_fun != NULL)
8408  {
8409  /* There is a function to solve the cycle. */
8410  if ((*v_p->cycle_fun) (v_p->tran_index, v_p->args) == NO_ERROR)
8411  ok = true;
8412  else
8413  ok = false;
8414  }
8415  else
8416  {
8417  ok = false;
8418  }
8419 
8420  /* If a function to break the cycle was not provided or the function failed, the transaction is
8421  * aborted/timed-out */
8422  if (ok == false)
8423  {
8424  if (v_p->can_timeout == false)
8425  {
8426  if (lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_aborted (v_p->tran_index) == false)
8427  msql_tm_abort_detected (v_p->tran_index, NULL);
8428  }
8429  else
8430  {
8431  if (lock_wakeup_deadlock_victim_timeout (v_p->tran_index) == false)
8432  msql_tm_timeout_detected (v_p->tran_index, NULL);
8433  }
8434  }
8435  }
8436  wfg_free_cycle (cycles);
8437 
8438  tot_num_victims += num_victims;
8439 
8440  if (num_victims >= LK_MAX_VICTIM_COUNT)
8441  cycle_case = WFG_CYCLE_YES_PRUNE;
8442  }
8443  }
8444 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8445 }
8446 #endif /* NOT_USED */
8447 
8448 /*
8449  * lock_reacquire_crash_locks - Reacquire given (exclusive) locks
8450  *
8451  * return: returns one value of following three:
8452  * (LK_GRANTED, LK_NOTGRANTED_DUE_TIMEOUT, LK_NOTGRANTED_DUE_ERROR)
8453  *
8454  * acqlocks(in): list of locks to be acquired
8455  * tran_index(in): transaction index
8456  * whose transaction needs to obtain the given locks
8457  *
8458  * Note:This function acquires locks (likely exclusive locks) which were
8459  * acquired before a crash on behalf of the specified transaction.
8460  *
8461  * Note: This function should only be called during recovery restart
8462  * time. The function does not try to get all or none of the locks
8463  * since they have already been granted to the transaction before
8464  * the crash. If a lock cannot be granted, an error is set and
8465  * returned, however, the fucntion will not stop acquiring the rest
8466  * of the indicated locks.
8467  */
8468 int
8469 lock_reacquire_crash_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ACQUIRED_LOCKS * acqlocks, int tran_index)
8470 {
8471 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8472  return LK_GRANTED;
8473 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8474  int granted = LK_GRANTED, r;
8475  unsigned int i;
8476  LK_ENTRY *dummy_ptr;
8477 
8478  if (acqlocks == NULL)
8479  {
8480  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LK_BAD_ARGUMENT, 2, "lk_reacquire_crash_locks",
8481  "NULL acqlocks pointer");
8482  return LK_NOTGRANTED_DUE_ERROR;
8483  }
8484 
8485  /* reacquire given exclusive locks on behalf of the transaction */
8486  for (i = 0; i < acqlocks->nobj_locks; i++)
8487  {
8488  /*
8489  * lock wait duration : LK_INFINITE_WAIT
8490  * conditional lock request : false
8491  */
8492  r = lock_internal_perform_lock_object (thread_p, tran_index, &acqlocks->obj[i].oid, &acqlocks->obj[i].class_oid,
8493  acqlocks->obj[i].lock, LK_INFINITE_WAIT, &dummy_ptr, NULL);
8494  if (r != LK_GRANTED)
8495  {
8496  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "lk_reacquire_crash_locks: The lock cannot be reacquired...");
8497  granted = r;
8498  continue;
8499  }
8500  }
8501  return granted;
8502 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8503 }
8504 
8505 /*
8506  * lock_unlock_all_shared_get_all_exclusive - Release all shared type locks and
8507  * optionally list the exclusive type locks
8508  *
8509  * return: nothing
8510  *
8511  * acqlocks(in/out):Get the list of acquired exclusive locks or NULL
8512  *
8513  * Note:Release all shared type locks (i.e., S_LOCK, IS_LOCK, SIX_LOCK
8514  * -- demoted to IX_LOCK), and obtain all remianing locks (i.e.,
8515  * exclusive locks such as IX_LOCK, X_LOCK).
8516  *
8517  * Note: This function must be called during the two phase commit
8518  * protocol of a distributed transaction.
8519  */
8520 void
8521 lock_unlock_all_shared_get_all_exclusive (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ACQUIRED_LOCKS * acqlocks)
8522 {
8523 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8524  /* No locks in standalone */
8525  if (acqlocks != NULL)
8526  {
8527  acqlocks->nobj_locks = 0;
8528  acqlocks->obj = NULL;
8529  }
8530  return;
8531 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8532  int tran_index;
8533  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
8534  int idx;
8535  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr;
8536  int rv;
8537 
8538  /* some preparation */
8539  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
8540 
8541  /************************************/
8542  /* phase 1: unlock all shared locks */
8543  /************************************/
8544  lock_demote_all_shared_class_locks (thread_p, tran_index);
8545  lock_remove_all_inst_locks (thread_p, tran_index, NULL, S_LOCK);
8546  lock_remove_all_class_locks (thread_p, tran_index, S_LOCK);
8547 
8548  /************************************/
8549  /* phase 2: get all exclusive locks */
8550  /************************************/
8551  if (acqlocks != NULL)
8552  {
8553  /* get a pointer to transaction lock info entry */
8554  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
8555 
8556  /* hold transction lock hold mutex */
8557  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
8558 
8559  /* get nobj_locks */
8560  acqlocks->nobj_locks = (unsigned int) (tran_lock->class_hold_count + tran_lock->inst_hold_count);
8561  if (tran_lock->root_class_hold != NULL)
8562  {
8563  acqlocks->nobj_locks += 1;
8564  }
8565 
8566  /* allocate momory space for saving exclusive lock information */
8567  acqlocks->obj = (LK_ACQOBJ_LOCK *) malloc (SIZEOF_LK_ACQOBJ_LOCK * acqlocks->nobj_locks);
8568  if (acqlocks->obj == NULL)
8569  {
8570  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
8571  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
8572  (size_t) (SIZEOF_LK_ACQOBJ_LOCK * acqlocks->nobj_locks));
8573  acqlocks->nobj_locks = 0;
8574  return;
8575  }
8576 
8577  /* initialize idx in acqlocks->obj array */
8578  idx = 0;
8579 
8580  /* collect root class lock information */
8581  entry_ptr = tran_lock->root_class_hold;
8582  if (entry_ptr != NULL)
8583  {
8584  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
8585 
8586  COPY_OID (&acqlocks->obj[idx].oid, oid_Root_class_oid);
8587  OID_SET_NULL (&acqlocks->obj[idx].class_oid);
8588  acqlocks->obj[idx].lock = entry_ptr->granted_mode;
8589  idx += 1;
8590  }
8591 
8592  /* collect general class lock information */
8593  for (entry_ptr = tran_lock->class_hold_list; entry_ptr != NULL; entry_ptr = entry_ptr->tran_next)
8594  {
8595  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
8596 
8597  COPY_OID (&acqlocks->obj[idx].oid, &entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid);
8598  COPY_OID (&acqlocks->obj[idx].class_oid, oid_Root_class_oid);
8599  acqlocks->obj[idx].lock = entry_ptr->granted_mode;
8600  idx += 1;
8601  }
8602 
8603  /* collect instance lock information */
8604  for (entry_ptr = tran_lock->inst_hold_list; entry_ptr != NULL; entry_ptr = entry_ptr->tran_next)
8605  {
8606  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
8607 
8608  COPY_OID (&acqlocks->obj[idx].oid, &entry_ptr->res_head->key.oid);
8609  COPY_OID (&acqlocks->obj[idx].class_oid, &entry_ptr->res_head->key.class_oid);
8610  acqlocks->obj[idx].lock = entry_ptr->granted_mode;
8611  idx += 1;
8612  }
8613 
8614  /* release transaction lock hold mutex */
8615  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
8616  }
8617  return;
8618 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8619 }
8620 
8621 /*
8622  * lock_dump_acquired - Dump structure of acquired locks
8623  *
8624  * return: nothing
8625  *
8626  * acqlocks(in): The acquired locks
8627  *
8628  * Note:Dump the structure of acquired locks
8629  */
8630 void
8631 lock_dump_acquired (FILE * fp, LK_ACQUIRED_LOCKS * acqlocks)
8632 {
8633 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8634  return;
8635 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8636  unsigned int i;
8637 
8638  /* Dump object locks */
8639  if (acqlocks->obj != NULL && acqlocks->nobj_locks > 0)
8640  {
8641  fprintf (fp, "Object_locks: count = %d\n", acqlocks->nobj_locks);
8642  for (i = 0; i < acqlocks->nobj_locks; i++)
8643  {
8644  fprintf (fp, " |%d|%d|%d| %s\n", acqlocks->obj[i].oid.volid, acqlocks->obj[i].oid.pageid,
8645  acqlocks->obj[i].oid.slotid, LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (acqlocks->obj[i].lock));
8646  }
8647  }
8648 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8649 }
8650 
8651 /*
8652  * xlock_dump - Dump the contents of lock table
8653  *
8654  * return: nothing
8655  *
8656  * outfp(in): FILE stream where to dump the lock table. If NULL is given,
8657  * it is dumped to stdout.
8658  *
8659  * Note:Dump the lock and waiting tables for both objects and pages.
8660  * That is, the lock activity of the datbase. It may be useful
8661  * for finding concurrency problems and locking bottlenecks on
8662  * an application, so that you can set the appropiate isolation
8663  * level or modify the design of the application.
8664  */
8665 void
8666 xlock_dump (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * outfp)
8667 {
8668 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8669  return;
8670 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8671  LF_HASH_TABLE_ITERATOR iterator;
8672 
8673  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_OBJ_LOCK_RES);
8674  char *client_prog_name; /* Client program name for tran */
8675  char *client_user_name; /* Client user name for tran */
8676  char *client_host_name; /* Client host for tran */
8677  int client_pid; /* Client process id for tran */
8678  TRAN_ISOLATION isolation; /* Isolation for client tran */
8679  TRAN_STATE state;
8680  int wait_msecs;
8681  int old_wait_msecs = 0; /* Old transaction lock wait */
8682  int tran_index;
8683  LK_RES *res_ptr;
8684  int num_locked;
8685  float lock_timeout_sec;
8686  char lock_timeout_string[64];
8687 
8688  if (outfp == NULL)
8689  {
8690  outfp = stdout;
8691  }
8692 
8693  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_NEWLINE));
8694  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_LOCK_TABLE),
8695  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT), prm_get_float_value (PRM_ID_LK_RUN_DEADLOCK_INTERVAL));
8696 
8697  /* Don't get block from anything when dumping object lock table. */
8698  old_wait_msecs = xlogtb_reset_wait_msecs (thread_p, LK_FORCE_ZERO_WAIT);
8699 
8700  /* Dump some information about all transactions */
8701  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_NEWLINE));
8702  for (tran_index = 0; tran_index < lk_Gl.num_trans; tran_index++)
8703  {
8704  if (logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (tran_index, &client_prog_name, &client_user_name, &client_host_name,
8705  &client_pid) != NO_ERROR)
8706  {
8707  /* Likely this index is not assigned */
8708  continue;
8709  }
8710  isolation = logtb_find_isolation (tran_index);
8711  state = logtb_find_state (tran_index);
8712  wait_msecs = logtb_find_wait_msecs (tran_index);
8713  lock_timeout_sec = lock_wait_msecs_to_secs (wait_msecs);
8714 
8715  if (lock_timeout_sec > 0)
8716  {
8717  sprintf (lock_timeout_string, ": %.2f", lock_timeout_sec);
8718  }
8719  else if ((int) lock_timeout_sec == LK_ZERO_WAIT || (int) lock_timeout_sec == LK_FORCE_ZERO_WAIT)
8720  {
8721  sprintf (lock_timeout_string, ": No wait");
8722  }
8723  else if ((int) lock_timeout_sec == LK_INFINITE_WAIT)
8724  {
8725  sprintf (lock_timeout_string, ": Infinite wait");
8726  }
8727  else
8728  {
8729  assert_release (0);
8730  sprintf (lock_timeout_string, ": %d", (int) lock_timeout_sec);
8731  }
8732 
8733  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_IDENTIFIERS),
8734  tran_index, client_prog_name, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid);
8735  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_ISOLATION),
8736  log_isolation_string (isolation));
8737  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_STATE),
8738  log_state_string (state));
8739  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_DUMP_TRAN_TIMEOUT_PERIOD),
8740  lock_timeout_string);
8741  fprintf (outfp, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOCK, MSGCAT_LK_NEWLINE));
8742  }
8743 
8744  /* compute number of lock res entries */
8745  num_locked =
8746  lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->alloc_cnt - lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->retired_cnt -
8747  lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->available_cnt;
8748  num_locked = MAX (num_locked, 0);
8749 
8750  /* dump object lock table */
8751  fprintf (outfp, "Object Lock Table:\n");
8752  fprintf (outfp, "\tCurrent number of objects which are locked = %d\n", num_locked);
8753  fprintf (outfp, "\tMaximum number of objects which can be locked = %d\n\n", lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->alloc_cnt);
8754 
8755  lf_hash_create_iterator (&iterator, t_entry, &lk_Gl.obj_hash_table);
8756  res_ptr = (LK_RES *) lf_hash_iterate (&iterator);
8757  for (; res_ptr != NULL; res_ptr = (LK_RES *) lf_hash_iterate (&iterator))
8758  {
8759  lock_dump_resource (thread_p, outfp, res_ptr);
8760  }
8761 
8762  /* Reset the wait back to the way it was */
8763  (void) xlogtb_reset_wait_msecs (thread_p, old_wait_msecs);
8764 
8765  return;
8766 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8767 }
8768 
8769 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
8770 /*
8771  * lock_check_consistency - Check consistency of lock table
8772  *
8773  * return: nothing
8774  *
8775  * Note:Check consistency of lock table.
8776  * This function is used for debugging purposes.
8777  */
8778 void
8779 lock_check_consistency (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
8780 {
8781 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8782  return;
8783 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8784  int consistent = true;
8785  int hash_index;
8786  LK_HASH *hash_anchor;
8787  LK_RES *res_ptr;
8788  int tran_index;
8789  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
8790  int rv;
8791 
8792  /* check the consisteny in object lock table */
8793  for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < lk_Gl.obj_hash_size; hash_index++)
8794  {
8795  hash_anchor = &lk_Gl.obj_hash_table[hash_index];
8796  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&hash_anchor->hash_mutex);
8797  res_ptr = hash_anchor->hash_next;
8798  while (res_ptr != NULL)
8799  {
8800  if (lock_check_consistent_resource (thread_p, res_ptr) == false)
8801  {
8802  consistent = false;
8803  fprintf (stderr, "lk_consistent: res_ptr is inconsistent.\n");
8804  break;
8805  }
8806  res_ptr = res_ptr->hash_next;
8807  }
8808  pthread_mutex_unlock (&hash_anchor->hash_mutex);
8809  if (consistent == false)
8810  {
8811  return;
8812  }
8813  }
8814 
8815  /* check transaction lock information */
8816  for (tran_index = 0; tran_index < lk_Gl.num_trans; tran_index++)
8817  {
8818  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
8819  if (lock_check_consistent_tran_lock (tran_lock) == false)
8820  {
8821  fprintf (stderr, "lk_consistent: tran_lock is inconsistent.\n");
8822  consistent = false;
8823  break;
8824  }
8825  }
8826  return;
8827 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8828 }
8829 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
8830 
8831 /*
8832  * lock_initialize_composite_lock -
8833  *
8834  * return: error code
8835  *
8836  * comp_lock(in):
8837  */
8838 int
8839 lock_initialize_composite_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK * comp_lock)
8840 {
8841 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8842  return NO_ERROR;
8843 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8844  LK_LOCKCOMP *lockcomp;
8845 
8846  lockcomp = &(comp_lock->lockcomp);
8847  lockcomp->tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
8848  lockcomp->wait_msecs = logtb_find_wait_msecs (lockcomp->tran_index);
8849  lockcomp->class_list = NULL;
8850  lockcomp->root_class_ptr = NULL;
8851  return NO_ERROR;
8852 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
8853 }
8854 
8855 /*
8856  * lock_add_composite_lock -
8857  *
8858  * return: error code
8859  *
8860  * comp_lock(in):
8861  * oid(in):
8862  * class_oid(in):
8863  * lock(in):
8864  */
8865 int
8866 lock_add_composite_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK * comp_lock, const OID * oid, const OID * class_oid)
8867 {
8868 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
8869  return NO_ERROR;
8870 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
8871  LK_LOCKCOMP *lockcomp;
8872  LK_LOCKCOMP_CLASS *lockcomp_class;
8873  OID *p;
8874  int max_oids;
8875  bool need_free;
8876  int ret = NO_ERROR;
8877 
8878  need_free = false; /* init */
8879 
8880  lockcomp = &(comp_lock->lockcomp);
8881  for (lockcomp_class = lockcomp->class_list; lockcomp_class != NULL; lockcomp_class = lockcomp_class->next)
8882  {
8883  if (OID_EQ (class_oid, &lockcomp_class->class_oid))
8884  {
8885  break;
8886  }
8887  }
8888 
8889  if (lockcomp_class == NULL)
8890  { /* class is not found */
8891  /* allocate lockcomp_class */
8892  lockcomp_class = (LK_LOCKCOMP_CLASS *) db_private_alloc (thread_p, sizeof (LK_LOCKCOMP_CLASS));
8893  if (lockcomp_class == NULL)
8894  {
8895  ret = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
8896  goto exit_on_error;
8897  }
8898 
8899  need_free = true;
8900 
8901  lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space = NULL; /* init */
8902 
8903  if (lockcomp->root_class_ptr == NULL)
8904  {
8905  lockcomp->root_class_ptr = lock_get_class_lock (thread_p, oid_Root_class_oid, lockcomp->tran_index);
8906  }
8907 
8908  /* initialize lockcomp_class */
8909  COPY_OID (&lockcomp_class->class_oid, class_oid);
8910  if (lock_internal_perform_lock_object (thread_p, lockcomp->tran_index, class_oid, NULL, IX_LOCK,
8911  lockcomp->wait_msecs, &lockcomp_class->class_lock_ptr,
8912  lockcomp->root_class_ptr) != LK_GRANTED)
8913  {
8914  ret = ER_FAILED;
8915  goto exit_on_error;
8916  }
8917  if (IS_WRITE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK (lockcomp_class->class_lock_ptr->granted_mode))
8918  {
8919  lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space = NULL;
8920  }
8921  else
8922  {
8923  if (LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK_OID_INCREMENT < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT))
8924  {
8925  lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids = LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK_OID_INCREMENT;
8926  }
8927  else
8928  {
8929  lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids = prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT);
8930  }
8931 
8932  lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space =
8933  (OID *) db_private_alloc (thread_p, sizeof (OID) * lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids);
8934  if (lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space == NULL)
8935  {
8936  ret = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
8937  goto exit_on_error;
8938  }
8939  lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids = 0;
8940  }
8941 
8942  /* connect lockcomp_class into the class_list of lockcomp */
8943  lockcomp_class->next = lockcomp->class_list;
8944  lockcomp->class_list = lockcomp_class;
8945 
8946  need_free = false;
8947  }
8948 
8949  if (lockcomp_class->class_lock_ptr->granted_mode < X_LOCK)
8950  {
8951  if (lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids == lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids)
8952  {
8953  if (lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT))
8954  {
8955  if ((lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids + LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK_OID_INCREMENT) <
8956  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT))
8957  {
8958  max_oids = lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids + LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK_OID_INCREMENT;
8959  }
8960  else
8961  {
8962  max_oids = prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT);
8963  }
8964  p = (OID *) db_private_realloc (thread_p, lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space, sizeof (OID) * max_oids);
8965  if (p == NULL)
8966  {
8967  ret = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
8968  goto exit_on_error;
8969  }
8970 
8971  lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space = p;
8972  lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids = max_oids;
8973  }
8974  }
8975 
8976  if (lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids < lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids)
8977  {
8978  COPY_OID (&lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space[lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids], oid);
8979  lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids++;
8980  }
8981  /* else, lockcomp_class->max_inst_oids equals PRM_LK_ESCALATION_AT. lock escalation will be performed. so no more
8982  * instance OID is stored. */
8983  }
8984 
8985  assert (ret == NO_ERROR);
8986 
8987 end:
8988 
8989  if (need_free)
8990  {
8991  if (lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space)
8992  {
8993  db_private_free_and_init (thread_p, lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space);
8994  }
8995  db_private_free_and_init (thread_p, lockcomp_class);
8996  }
8997 
8998  return ret;
8999 
9000 exit_on_error:
9001 
9002  assert (ret != NO_ERROR);
9003  if (ret == NO_ERROR)
9004  {
9005  ret = ER_FAILED;
9006  }
9007 
9008  goto end;
9009 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9010 }
9011 
9012 /*
9013  * lock_finalize_composite_lock -
9014  *
9015  * return:
9016  *
9017  * comp_lock(in):
9018  */
9019 int
9020 lock_finalize_composite_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK * comp_lock)
9021 {
9022 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9023  return LK_GRANTED;
9024 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9025  LK_LOCKCOMP *lockcomp;
9026  LK_LOCKCOMP_CLASS *lockcomp_class;
9027  LK_ENTRY *dummy;
9028  int i, value = LK_GRANTED;
9029 
9030  lockcomp = &(comp_lock->lockcomp);
9031  for (lockcomp_class = lockcomp->class_list; lockcomp_class != NULL; lockcomp_class = lockcomp_class->next)
9032  {
9033  if (IS_WRITE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK (lockcomp_class->class_lock_ptr->granted_mode)
9034  || lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids == prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_LK_ESCALATION_AT))
9035  {
9036  /* hold X_LOCK on the class object */
9037  value = lock_internal_perform_lock_object (thread_p, lockcomp->tran_index, &lockcomp_class->class_oid, NULL,
9038  X_LOCK, lockcomp->wait_msecs, &dummy, lockcomp->root_class_ptr);
9039  if (value != LK_GRANTED)
9040  {
9041  break;
9042  }
9043  }
9044  else
9045  {
9046  /* hold X_LOCKs on the instance objects */
9047  for (i = 0; i < lockcomp_class->num_inst_oids; i++)
9048  {
9049  value = lock_internal_perform_lock_object (thread_p, lockcomp->tran_index,
9050  &lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space[i],
9051  &lockcomp_class->class_oid, X_LOCK, lockcomp->wait_msecs,
9052  &dummy, lockcomp_class->class_lock_ptr);
9053  if (value != LK_GRANTED)
9054  {
9055  break;
9056  }
9057  }
9058  if (value != LK_GRANTED)
9059  {
9060  break;
9061  }
9062  }
9063  }
9064 
9065  /* free alloced memory for composite locking */
9066  lock_abort_composite_lock (comp_lock);
9067 
9068  return value;
9069 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9070 }
9071 
9072 /*
9073  * lock_abort_composite_lock -
9074  *
9075  * return:
9076  *
9077  * comp_lock(in):
9078  */
9079 void
9080 lock_abort_composite_lock (LK_COMPOSITE_LOCK * comp_lock)
9081 {
9082 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9083  return;
9084 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9085  LK_LOCKCOMP *lockcomp;
9086  LK_LOCKCOMP_CLASS *lockcomp_class;
9087 
9088  lockcomp = &(comp_lock->lockcomp);
9089  lockcomp->tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
9090  lockcomp->wait_msecs = 0;
9091  while (lockcomp->class_list != NULL)
9092  {
9093  lockcomp_class = lockcomp->class_list;
9094  lockcomp->class_list = lockcomp_class->next;
9095  if (lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space)
9096  {
9097  db_private_free_and_init (NULL, lockcomp_class->inst_oid_space);
9098  }
9099  db_private_free_and_init (NULL, lockcomp_class);
9100  }
9101 
9102 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9103 }
9104 
9105 /*
9106  * lock_is_class_lock_escalated - check if class lock is escalated
9107  *
9108  * return: true if class lock is escalated, false otherwise
9109  *
9110  * class_lock(in): class lock
9111  * lock_escalation(in): lock escalation
9112  */
9113 static bool
9114 lock_is_class_lock_escalated (LOCK class_lock, LOCK lock_escalation)
9115 {
9116 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9117  return false;
9118 #else
9119  if (class_lock < lock_escalation && !IS_WRITE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK (class_lock))
9120  {
9121  return false;
9122  }
9123 
9124  if (class_lock == IX_LOCK && lock_escalation == S_LOCK)
9125  {
9126  return false;
9127  }
9128 
9129  return true;
9130 #endif
9131 }
9132 
9133 /*
9134  * lock_get_number_object_locks - Number of object lock entries
9135  *
9136  * return:
9137  *
9138  * Note:Find the number of total object lock entries of all
9139  * transactions
9140  */
9141 unsigned int
9142 lock_get_number_object_locks (void)
9143 {
9144 #if defined(SA_MODE)
9145  return 0;
9146 #else
9147  int available = lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->available_cnt;
9148  int retired = lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->retired_cnt;
9149  int allocd = lk_Gl.obj_hash_table.freelist->alloc_cnt;
9150 
9151  /* might fetch values mid-operation, so impose a lower cap */
9152  return MAX (allocd - available - retired, 0);
9153 #endif
9154 }
9155 
9156 /*
9157  * lock_start_instant_lock_mode -
9158  *
9159  * return:
9160  *
9161  * tran_index(in):
9162  */
9163 void
9164 lock_start_instant_lock_mode (int tran_index)
9165 {
9166 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9167  return;
9168 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9169  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
9170 
9171  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9172  tran_lock->is_instant_duration = true;
9173  return;
9174 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9175 }
9176 
9177 /*
9178  * lock_stop_instant_lock_mode -
9179  *
9180  * return:
9181  *
9182  * tran_index(in):
9183  * need_unlock(in):
9184  */
9185 void
9186 lock_stop_instant_lock_mode (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, bool need_unlock)
9187 {
9188 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9189  return;
9190 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9191  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
9192  LK_ENTRY *entry_ptr, *next_ptr;
9193  int count;
9194 
9195  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9196 
9197  if (!tran_lock->is_instant_duration)
9198  {
9199  /* if already stopped, return */
9200  return;
9201  }
9202 
9203  /* remove instance locks */
9204  entry_ptr = tran_lock->inst_hold_list;
9205  while (entry_ptr != NULL)
9206  {
9207  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
9208 
9209  next_ptr = entry_ptr->tran_next;
9210  count = entry_ptr->instant_lock_count;
9211  assert_release (count >= 0);
9212  if (need_unlock)
9213  {
9214  assert_release (count >= 0);
9215  while (count > 0)
9216  {
9217  lock_internal_perform_unlock_object (thread_p, entry_ptr, false, true);
9218  count--;
9219  }
9220  }
9221  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
9222  entry_ptr = next_ptr;
9223  }
9224 
9225  /* remove class locks */
9226  entry_ptr = tran_lock->class_hold_list;
9227  while (entry_ptr != NULL)
9228  {
9229  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
9230 
9231  next_ptr = entry_ptr->tran_next;
9232  count = entry_ptr->instant_lock_count;
9233  assert_release (count >= 0);
9234  if (need_unlock)
9235  {
9236  assert_release (count >= 0);
9237  while (count > 0)
9238  {
9239  lock_internal_perform_unlock_object (thread_p, entry_ptr, false, true);
9240  count--;
9241  }
9242  }
9243  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
9244  entry_ptr = next_ptr;
9245  }
9246 
9247  /* remove root class lock */
9248  entry_ptr = tran_lock->root_class_hold;
9249  if (entry_ptr != NULL)
9250  {
9251  assert (tran_index == entry_ptr->tran_index);
9252 
9253  count = entry_ptr->instant_lock_count;
9254  assert_release (count >= 0);
9255  if (need_unlock)
9256  {
9257  assert_release (count >= 0);
9258  while (count > 0)
9259  {
9260  lock_internal_perform_unlock_object (thread_p, entry_ptr, false, true);
9261  count--;
9262  }
9263  }
9264  entry_ptr->instant_lock_count = 0;
9265  }
9266 
9267  /* change locking phase as normal */
9268  tran_lock->is_instant_duration = false;
9269  return;
9270 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9271 }
9272 
9273 /* lock_clear_deadlock_victim:
9274  *
9275  * tran_index(in):
9276  */
9277 void
9278 lock_clear_deadlock_victim (int tran_index)
9279 {
9280 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9281  return;
9282 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9283  int rv;
9284 
9285  /* communication with deadlock detector */
9286  if (lk_Gl.TWFG_node[tran_index].checked_by_deadlock_detector)
9287  {
9288  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[tran_index].checked_by_deadlock_detector = false;
9289  }
9290  if (lk_Gl.TWFG_node[tran_index].DL_victim)
9291  {
9292  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&lk_Gl.DL_detection_mutex);
9293  lk_Gl.TWFG_node[tran_index].DL_victim = false;
9294  pthread_mutex_unlock (&lk_Gl.DL_detection_mutex);
9295 
9296  // reset its tran_abort_reason
9297  lock_set_tran_abort_reason (tran_index, TRAN_NORMAL);
9298  }
9299 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9300 }
9301 
9302 /*
9303  * lock_is_instant_lock_mode -
9304  *
9305  * return:
9306  *
9307  * tran_index(in):
9308  */
9309 bool
9310 lock_is_instant_lock_mode (int tran_index)
9311 {
9312 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9313  return false;
9314 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9315  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
9316 
9317  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9318  return tran_lock->is_instant_duration;
9319 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
9320 }
9321 
9322 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
9323 /*
9324  * lock_increment_class_granules () - increment the lock counter for a class
9325  * return : void
9326  * class_entry (in/out) : class entry
9327  *
9328  */
9329 static void
9330 lock_increment_class_granules (LK_ENTRY * class_entry)
9331 {
9332  if (class_entry == NULL || class_entry->res_head->key.type != LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS)
9333  {
9334  return;
9335  }
9336 
9337  class_entry->ngranules++;
9338  if (class_entry->class_entry != NULL && !OID_IS_ROOTOID (&class_entry->class_entry->res_head->key.oid))
9339  {
9340  /* This is a class in a class hierarchy so increment the number of granules for the superclass */
9341  class_entry->class_entry->ngranules++;
9342  }
9343 }
9344 
9345 /*
9346  * lock_decrement_class_granules () - decrement the lock counter for a class
9347  * return : void
9348  * class_entry (in/out) : class entry
9349  *
9350  */
9351 static void
9352 lock_decrement_class_granules (LK_ENTRY * class_entry)
9353 {
9354  if (class_entry == NULL || class_entry->res_head->key.type != LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS)
9355  {
9356  return;
9357  }
9358 
9359  class_entry->ngranules--;
9360  if (class_entry->class_entry != NULL && !OID_IS_ROOTOID (&class_entry->class_entry->res_head->key.oid))
9361  {
9362  /* This is a class in a class hierarchy so decrement the number of granules for the superclass */
9363  class_entry->class_entry->ngranules--;
9364  }
9365 }
9366 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
9367 
9368 /*
9369  * lock_get_lock_holder_tran_index -
9370  *
9371  * return:
9372  * out_buf(out):
9373  * waiter_index(in):
9374  * res (in):
9375  *
9376  * note : caller must free *out_buf.
9377  */
9378 int
9379 lock_get_lock_holder_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, char **out_buf, int waiter_index, LK_RES * res)
9380 {
9381 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9382  if (res == NULL)
9383  {
9384  return NO_ERROR;
9385  }
9386 
9387  if (out_buf == NULL)
9388  {
9389  assert_release (0);
9390  return ER_FAILED;
9391  }
9392 
9393  *out_buf = NULL;
9394 
9395  return NO_ERROR;
9396 
9397 #else
9398 
9399 #define HOLDER_ENTRY_LENGTH (12)
9400  int rv;
9401  LK_ENTRY *holder, *waiter;
9402  int holder_number = 0;
9403  int buf_size, n, remained_size;
9404  bool is_valid = false; /* validation check */
9405  char *buf, *p;
9406 
9407  if (res == NULL)
9408  {
9409  return NO_ERROR;
9410  }
9411 
9412  if (out_buf == NULL)
9413  {
9414  assert_release (0);
9415  return ER_FAILED;
9416  }
9417 
9418  *out_buf = NULL;
9419 
9420  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&res->res_mutex);
9421  if (rv != 0)
9422  {
9423  return ER_FAILED;
9424  }
9425 
9426  if (OID_ISNULL (&res->key.oid))
9427  {
9428  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res->res_mutex);
9429  return NO_ERROR;
9430  }
9431 
9432  waiter = res->waiter;
9433  while (waiter != NULL)
9434  {
9435  if (waiter->tran_index == waiter_index)
9436  {
9437  is_valid = true;
9438  break;
9439  }
9440  waiter = waiter->next;
9441  }
9442 
9443  if (is_valid == false)
9444  {
9445  holder = res->holder;
9446  while (holder != NULL)
9447  {
9448  if (holder->blocked_mode != NULL_LOCK && holder->tran_index == waiter_index)
9449  {
9450  is_valid = true;
9451  break;
9452  }
9453  holder = holder->next;
9454  }
9455  }
9456 
9457  if (is_valid == false)
9458  {
9459  /* not a valid waiter of this resource */
9460  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res->res_mutex);
9461  return NO_ERROR;
9462  }
9463 
9464  holder = res->holder;
9465  while (holder != NULL)
9466  {
9467  if (holder->tran_index != waiter_index)
9468  {
9469  holder_number++;
9470  }
9471  holder = holder->next;
9472  }
9473 
9474  if (holder_number == 0)
9475  {
9476  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res->res_mutex);
9477  return NO_ERROR;
9478  }
9479 
9480  buf_size = holder_number * HOLDER_ENTRY_LENGTH + 1;
9481  buf = (char *) malloc (sizeof (char) * buf_size);
9482 
9483  if (buf == NULL)
9484  {
9485  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res->res_mutex);
9486 
9487  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) buf_size);
9488  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
9489  }
9490 
9491  remained_size = buf_size;
9492  p = buf;
9493 
9494  /* write first holder index */
9495  holder = res->holder;
9496  while (holder && holder->tran_index == waiter_index)
9497  {
9498  holder = holder->next;
9499  }
9500 
9501  assert_release (holder != NULL);
9502 
9503  n = snprintf (p, remained_size, "%d", holder->tran_index);
9504  remained_size -= n;
9505  p += n;
9506  assert_release (remained_size >= 0);
9507 
9508  /* write remained holder index */
9509  holder = holder->next;
9510  while (holder != NULL)
9511  {
9512  if (holder->tran_index != waiter_index)
9513  {
9514  n = snprintf (p, remained_size, ", %d", holder->tran_index);
9515  remained_size -= n;
9516  p += n;
9517  assert_release (remained_size >= 0);
9518  }
9519  holder = holder->next;
9520  }
9521 
9522  *out_buf = buf;
9523 
9524  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res->res_mutex);
9525 
9526  return NO_ERROR;
9527 #endif
9528 }
9529 
9530 /*
9531  * lock_wait_state_to_string () - Translate lock wait state into string
9532  * representation
9533  * return:
9534  * state(in): lock wait state
9535  */
9536 const char *
9537 lock_wait_state_to_string (int state)
9538 {
9539  switch (state)
9540  {
9541  case LOCK_SUSPENDED:
9542  return "SUSPENDED";
9543  case LOCK_RESUMED:
9544  return "RESUMED";
9545  case LOCK_RESUMED_TIMEOUT:
9546  return "RESUMED_TIMEOUT";
9547  case LOCK_RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT:
9548  return "RESUMED_DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT";
9549  case LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED:
9550  return "RESUMED_ABORTED";
9551  case LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_FIRST:
9552  return "RESUMED_ABORTED_FIRST";
9553  case LOCK_RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER:
9554  return "RESUMED_ABORTED_OTHER";
9555  case LOCK_RESUMED_INTERRUPT:
9556  return "RESUMED_INTERRUPT";
9557  }
9558  return "UNKNOWN";
9559 }
9560 
9561 /*
9562  * lock dump to event log file (lock timeout, deadlock)
9563  */
9564 
9565 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
9566 /*
9567  * lock_event_log_tran_locks - dump transaction locks to event log file
9568  * return:
9569  * thread_p(in):
9570  * log_fp(in):
9571  * tran_index(in):
9572  *
9573  * note: for deadlock
9574  */
9575 static void
9576 lock_event_log_tran_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, int tran_index)
9577 {
9578  int rv, i, indent = 2;
9579  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
9580  LK_ENTRY *entry;
9581 
9582  assert (csect_check_own (thread_p, CSECT_EVENT_LOG_FILE) == 1);
9583 
9584  fprintf (log_fp, "hold:\n");
9585 
9586  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9587  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
9588 
9589  entry = tran_lock->inst_hold_list;
9590  for (i = 0; entry != NULL && i < MAX_NUM_LOCKS_DUMP_TO_EVENT_LOG; entry = entry->tran_next, i++)
9591  {
9592  assert (tran_index == entry->tran_index);
9593 
9594  fprintf (log_fp, "%*clock: %s", indent, ' ', LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry->granted_mode));
9595 
9596  SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY (thread_p, entry);
9597  lock_event_log_lock_info (thread_p, log_fp, entry);
9598 
9599  event_log_sql_string (thread_p, log_fp, &entry->xasl_id, indent);
9600  event_log_bind_values (thread_p, log_fp, tran_index, entry->bind_index_in_tran);
9601 
9602  fprintf (log_fp, "\n");
9603 
9604  CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD (thread_p);
9605  }
9606 
9607  if (entry != NULL)
9608  {
9609  fprintf (log_fp, "%*c...\n", indent, ' ');
9610  }
9611 
9612  entry = tran_lock->waiting;
9613  if (entry != NULL)
9614  {
9615  fprintf (log_fp, "wait:\n");
9616  fprintf (log_fp, "%*clock: %s", indent, ' ', LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry->blocked_mode));
9617 
9618  SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY (thread_p, entry);
9619 
9620  lock_event_log_lock_info (thread_p, log_fp, entry);
9621 
9622  event_log_sql_string (thread_p, log_fp, &entry->xasl_id, indent);
9623  event_log_bind_values (thread_p, log_fp, tran_index, entry->bind_index_in_tran);
9624 
9625  fprintf (log_fp, "\n");
9626  }
9627  CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD (thread_p);
9628 
9629  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
9630 }
9631 
9632 /*
9633  * lock_event_log_blocked_lock - dump lock waiter info to event log file
9634  * return:
9635  * thread_p(in):
9636  * log_fp(in):
9637  * entry(in):
9638  *
9639  * note: for lock timeout
9640  */
9641 static void
9642 lock_event_log_blocked_lock (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * entry)
9643 {
9644  int indent = 2;
9645 
9646  assert (csect_check_own (thread_p, CSECT_EVENT_LOG_FILE) == 1);
9647 
9648  SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY (thread_p, entry);
9649 
9650  fprintf (log_fp, "waiter:\n");
9651  event_log_print_client_info (entry->tran_index, indent);
9652 
9653  fprintf (log_fp, "%*clock: %s", indent, ' ', LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry->blocked_mode));
9654  lock_event_log_lock_info (thread_p, log_fp, entry);
9655 
9656  event_log_sql_string (thread_p, log_fp, &entry->xasl_id, indent);
9657  event_log_bind_values (thread_p, log_fp, entry->tran_index, entry->bind_index_in_tran);
9658 
9659  CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD (thread_p);
9660 
9661  fprintf (log_fp, "\n");
9662 }
9663 
9664 /*
9665  * lock_event_log_blocking_locks - dump lock blocker info to event log file
9666  * return:
9667  * thread_p(in):
9668  * log_fp(in):
9669  * wait_entry(in):
9670  *
9671  * note: for lock timeout
9672  */
9673 static void
9674 lock_event_log_blocking_locks (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * wait_entry)
9675 {
9676  LK_ENTRY *entry;
9677  LK_RES *res_ptr = NULL;
9678  LOCK_COMPATIBILITY compat1, compat2;
9679  int rv, indent = 2;
9680 
9681  assert (csect_check_own (thread_p, CSECT_EVENT_LOG_FILE) == 1);
9682 
9683  res_ptr = wait_entry->res_head;
9684  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
9685 
9686  fprintf (log_fp, "blocker:\n");
9687 
9688  for (entry = res_ptr->holder; entry != NULL; entry = entry->next)
9689  {
9690  if (entry == wait_entry)
9691  {
9692  continue;
9693  }
9694 
9695  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry->granted_mode][wait_entry->blocked_mode];
9696  compat2 = lock_Comp[entry->blocked_mode][wait_entry->blocked_mode];
9697  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN && compat2 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
9698 
9699  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO || compat2 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
9700  {
9701  event_log_print_client_info (entry->tran_index, indent);
9702 
9703  fprintf (log_fp, "%*clock: %s", indent, ' ', LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry->granted_mode));
9704 
9705  SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY (thread_p, entry);
9706 
9707  lock_event_log_lock_info (thread_p, log_fp, entry);
9708 
9709  event_log_sql_string (thread_p, log_fp, &entry->xasl_id, indent);
9710  event_log_bind_values (thread_p, log_fp, entry->tran_index, entry->bind_index_in_tran);
9711 
9712  CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD (thread_p);
9713 
9714  fprintf (log_fp, "\n");
9715  }
9716  }
9717 
9718  for (entry = res_ptr->waiter; entry != NULL; entry = entry->next)
9719  {
9720  if (entry == wait_entry)
9721  {
9722  continue;
9723  }
9724 
9725  compat1 = lock_Comp[entry->blocked_mode][wait_entry->blocked_mode];
9726  assert (compat1 != LOCK_COMPAT_UNKNOWN);
9727 
9728  if (compat1 == LOCK_COMPAT_NO)
9729  {
9730  event_log_print_client_info (entry->tran_index, indent);
9731 
9732  fprintf (log_fp, "%*clock: %s", indent, ' ', LOCK_TO_LOCKMODE_STRING (entry->granted_mode));
9733 
9734  SET_EMULATE_THREAD_WITH_LOCK_ENTRY (thread_p, entry);
9735 
9736  lock_event_log_lock_info (thread_p, log_fp, entry);
9737 
9738  event_log_sql_string (thread_p, log_fp, &entry->xasl_id, indent);
9739  event_log_bind_values (thread_p, log_fp, entry->tran_index, entry->bind_index_in_tran);
9740 
9741  CLEAR_EMULATE_THREAD (thread_p);
9742 
9743  fprintf (log_fp, "\n");
9744  }
9745  }
9746 
9747  pthread_mutex_unlock (&res_ptr->res_mutex);
9748 }
9749 
9750 /*
9751  * lock_event_log_lock_info - dump lock resource info to event log file
9752  * return:
9753  * thread_p(in):
9754  * log_fp(in):
9755  * entry(in):
9756  */
9757 static void
9758 lock_event_log_lock_info (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * log_fp, LK_ENTRY * entry)
9759 {
9760  LK_RES *res_ptr;
9761  char *classname;
9762  OID *oid_rr;
9763 
9764  assert (csect_check_own (thread_p, CSECT_EVENT_LOG_FILE) == 1);
9765 
9766  res_ptr = entry->res_head;
9767 
9768  fprintf (log_fp, " (oid=%d|%d|%d", res_ptr->key.oid.volid, res_ptr->key.oid.pageid, res_ptr->key.oid.slotid);
9769 
9770  switch (res_ptr->key.type)
9771  {
9772  case LOCK_RESOURCE_ROOT_CLASS:
9773  fprintf (log_fp, ", table=db_root");
9774  break;
9775 
9776  case LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS:
9777  oid_rr = oid_get_rep_read_tran_oid ();
9778  if (oid_rr != NULL && OID_EQ (&res_ptr->key.oid, oid_rr))
9779  {
9780  /* This is the generic object for RR transactions */
9781  fprintf (log_fp, ", Generic object for Repeatable Read consistency");
9782  }
9783  else if (!OID_ISTEMP (&res_ptr->key.oid))
9784  {
9785  OID real_class_oid;
9786 
9787  if (OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&res_ptr->key.oid))
9788  {
9789  OID_GET_REAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&res_ptr->key.oid, &real_class_oid);
9790  }
9791  else
9792  {
9793  COPY_OID (&real_class_oid, &res_ptr->key.oid);
9794  }
9795 
9796  /* never propagate an error to get class name and keep the existing error if any. */
9797  er_stack_push ();
9798  (void) heap_get_class_name (thread_p, &real_class_oid, &classname);
9799  er_stack_pop ();
9800 
9801  if (classname != NULL)
9802  {
9803  fprintf (log_fp, ", table=%s", classname);
9804  free_and_init (classname);
9805  }
9806  }
9807  break;
9808 
9809  case LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE:
9810  if (!OID_ISTEMP (&res_ptr->key.class_oid))
9811  {
9812  OID real_class_oid;
9813 
9814  if (OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&res_ptr->key.class_oid))
9815  {
9816  OID_GET_REAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&res_ptr->key.class_oid, &real_class_oid);
9817  }
9818  else
9819  {
9820  COPY_OID (&real_class_oid, &res_ptr->key.class_oid);
9821  }
9822 
9823  /* never propagate an error to get class name and keep the existing error if any. */
9824  er_stack_push ();
9825  (void) heap_get_class_name (thread_p, &real_class_oid, &classname);
9826  er_stack_pop ();
9827 
9828  if (classname != NULL)
9829  {
9830  fprintf (log_fp, ", table=%s", classname);
9831  free_and_init (classname);
9832  }
9833  }
9834  break;
9835 
9836  default:
9837  break;
9838  }
9839 
9840  fprintf (log_fp, ")\n");
9841 }
9842 
9843 /*
9844  * lock_event_set_tran_wait_entry - save the lock entry tran is waiting
9845  * return:
9846  * entry(in):
9847  */
9848 static void
9849 lock_event_set_tran_wait_entry (int tran_index, LK_ENTRY * entry)
9850 {
9851  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock;
9852  int rv;
9853 
9854  tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9855  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
9856 
9857  tran_lock->waiting = entry;
9858 
9859  if (entry != NULL)
9860  {
9861  lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry (tran_index, entry);
9862  }
9863 
9864  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tran_lock->hold_mutex);
9865 }
9866 
9867 /*
9868  * lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry - save the xasl id related lock entry
9869  * return:
9870  * entry(in):
9871  */
9872 static void
9873 lock_event_set_xasl_id_to_entry (int tran_index, LK_ENTRY * entry)
9874 {
9875  LOG_TDES *tdes;
9876 
9877  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
9878  if (tdes != NULL && !XASL_ID_IS_NULL (&tdes->xasl_id))
9879  {
9880  if (tdes->num_exec_queries <= MAX_NUM_EXEC_QUERY_HISTORY)
9881  {
9882  entry->bind_index_in_tran = tdes->num_exec_queries - 1;
9883  }
9884  else
9885  {
9886  entry->bind_index_in_tran = -1;
9887  }
9888 
9889  XASL_ID_COPY (&entry->xasl_id, &tdes->xasl_id);
9890  }
9891  else
9892  {
9893  XASL_ID_SET_NULL (&entry->xasl_id);
9894  entry->bind_index_in_tran = -1;
9895  }
9896 }
9897 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
9898 
9899 /*
9900  * lock_rep_read_tran - lock the object used in RR transaction with ALTER TABLE
9901  * ADDCOLUMN NOT NULL scenario
9902  * return:
9903  * thread_p(in):
9904  * lock(in): type of lock
9905  * cond_flag
9906  */
9907 int
9908 lock_rep_read_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOCK lock, int cond_flag)
9909 {
9910 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
9911  LK_SET_STANDALONE_XLOCK (lock);
9912  return NO_ERROR;
9913 #else /* !SERVER_MODE */
9914  int tran_index;
9915  int wait_msecs;
9916  OID *rep_read_oid = oid_get_rep_read_tran_oid ();
9917  LK_ENTRY *entry_addr = NULL;
9918 
9919  if (lock == NULL_LOCK)
9920  {
9921  return NO_ERROR;
9922  }
9923 
9924  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
9925  if (cond_flag == LK_COND_LOCK) /* conditional request */
9926  {
9927  wait_msecs = LK_FORCE_ZERO_WAIT;
9928  }
9929  else
9930  {
9931  wait_msecs = logtb_find_wait_msecs (tran_index);
9932  }
9933 
9934  if (lock_internal_perform_lock_object (thread_p, tran_index, rep_read_oid, NULL, lock, wait_msecs, &entry_addr,
9935  NULL) != LK_GRANTED)
9936  {
9937  return ER_FAILED;
9938  }
9939 
9940  return NO_ERROR;
9941 #endif
9942 }
9943 
9944 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
9945 static bool
9946 lock_is_safe_lock_with_page (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LK_ENTRY * entry_ptr)
9947 {
9948  LK_RES *lock_res;
9949  bool is_safe = true;
9950 
9951  lock_res = entry_ptr->res_head;
9952  if (lock_res != NULL)
9953  {
9954  is_safe = false;
9955  if (lock_res->key.type == LOCK_RESOURCE_INSTANCE && OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&lock_res->key.class_oid))
9956  {
9957  is_safe = true;
9958  }
9959  else if (lock_res->key.type == LOCK_RESOURCE_CLASS && OID_IS_VIRTUAL_CLASS_OF_DIR_OID (&lock_res->key.oid))
9960  {
9961  is_safe = true;
9962  }
9963  }
9964  return is_safe;
9965 }
9966 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
9967 
9968 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
9969 /*
9970  * lock_get_new_entry () - Get new lock entry. Local pool of free entries is
9971  * first used. When this pool is depleted, a new
9972  * entry is claimed from shared list of lock entries.
9973  *
9974  * return : New lock entry.
9975  * tran_index (in) : Transaction index of requester.
9976  * tran_entry (in) : Lock-free transaction entry.
9977  * freelist (in) : Lock-free shared list of entries.
9978  */
9979 static LK_ENTRY *
9980 lock_get_new_entry (int tran_index, LF_TRAN_ENTRY * tran_entry, LF_FREELIST * freelist)
9981 {
9982  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
9983  LK_ENTRY *lock_entry;
9984 
9985  /* Check if local pool has free entries. */
9986  if (tran_lock->lk_entry_pool)
9987  {
9988  assert (tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count > 0);
9989  lock_entry = tran_lock->lk_entry_pool;
9990  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool = tran_lock->lk_entry_pool->next;
9991  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count--;
9992  return lock_entry;
9993  }
9994 
9995  /* Claim from shared freelist. */
9996  return (LK_ENTRY *) lf_freelist_claim (tran_entry, freelist);
9997 }
9998 
9999 /*
10000  * lock_free_entry () - Free lock entry. Local pool has high priority if its
10001  * maximum size is not reached. Otherwise, the entry
10002  * is "retired" to shared list of free lock entries.
10003  *
10004  * return : Error code.
10005  * tran_index (in) : Transaction index.
10006  * tran_entry (in) : Lock-free transaction entry.
10007  * freelist (in) : Lock-free shared list of lock entries.
10008  * lock_entry (in) : Lock entry being freed.
10009  */
10010 static void
10011 lock_free_entry (int tran_index, LF_TRAN_ENTRY * tran_entry, LF_FREELIST * freelist, LK_ENTRY * lock_entry)
10012 {
10013  LK_TRAN_LOCK *tran_lock = &lk_Gl.tran_lock_table[tran_index];
10014 
10015  assert (tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count >= 0 && tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count <= LOCK_TRAN_LOCAL_POOL_MAX_SIZE);
10016 
10017  /* "Free" entry to local pool or shared list. */
10018  if (tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count < LOCK_TRAN_LOCAL_POOL_MAX_SIZE)
10019  {
10020  lock_uninit_entry (lock_entry);
10021  lock_entry->next = tran_lock->lk_entry_pool;
10022  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool = lock_entry;
10023  tran_lock->lk_entry_pool_count++;
10024  }
10025  else
10026  {
10027  lf_freelist_retire (tran_entry, freelist, lock_entry);
10028  }
10029 }
10030 #endif
10031 
10032 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
10033 /*
10034  * lock_unlock_object_by_isolation - No lock is unlocked/demoted for MVCC tables.
10035  * Shared instance lock on non-MVCC table is unlocked for TRAN_READ_COMMITTED.
10036  *
10037  * return : nothing
10038  * tran_index(in): Transaction index.
10039  * class_oid(in): class oid.
10040  * oid(in): instance oid.
10041  */
10042 static void
10043 lock_unlock_object_by_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation,
10044  const OID * class_oid, const OID * oid)
10045 {
10046  assert (class_oid != NULL && oid != NULL);
10047  assert (!OID_ISNULL (class_oid) && !OID_ISNULL (oid));
10048 
10049  if (isolation != TRAN_READ_COMMITTED)
10050  {
10051  return; /* do nothing */
10052  }
10053 
10054  /* The intentional lock on the higher lock granule must be kept. */
10055  if (OID_IS_ROOTOID (oid) || OID_IS_ROOTOID (class_oid))
10056  {
10057  /* Don't release locks on classes. READ COMMITTED isolation is only applied on instances, classes must
10058  * have at least REPEATABLE READ isolation. */
10059  }
10060  else if (mvcc_is_mvcc_disabled_class (class_oid))
10061  {
10062  /* Release S_LOCK after reading object. */
10063  lock_unlock_shared_inst_lock (thread_p, tran_index, oid);
10064  }
10065  else
10066  {
10067  /* MVCC table. READ COMMITTED isolation uses snapshot instead of locks. We don't have to release anything here. */
10068  }
10069 }
10070 
10071 /*
10072  * lock_unlock_inst_locks_of_class_by_isolation - No lock is unlocked/demoted for MVCC tables.
10073  * Shared instance locks on non-MVCC table is unlocked for
10074  * TRAN_READ_COMMITTED.
10075  *
10076  * return : nothing
10077  * tran_index(in): Transaction index.
10078  * class_oid(in): class oid.
10079  */
10080 static void
10081 lock_unlock_inst_locks_of_class_by_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation,
10082  const OID * class_oid)
10083 {
10084  assert (class_oid != NULL);
10085  assert (!OID_ISNULL (class_oid));
10086 
10087  if (isolation != TRAN_READ_COMMITTED)
10088  {
10089  return; /* do nothing */
10090  }
10091 
10092  if (mvcc_is_mvcc_disabled_class (class_oid))
10093  {
10094  /* Release S_LOCKs of non-MVCC tables. */
10095  lock_remove_all_inst_locks (thread_p, tran_index, class_oid, S_LOCK);
10096  }
10097  else
10098  {
10099  /* MVCC table. READ COMMITTED isolation uses snapshot instead of locks. We don't have to release anything here. */
10100  }
10101 }
10102 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
10103 
10104 //
10105 // lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads_mapfunc -
10106 //
10107 // thread_ref (in) : thread entry
10108 // stop_mapper (out) : ignored
10109 // tran_index (in) : transaction index
10110 // tran_lock_waiters (out) : output lock waiter threads belonging to transaction
10111 // count (out) : output thread count
10112 //
10113 static void
10114 lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper, int tran_index,
10115  tran_lock_waiters_array_type & tran_lock_waiters, size_t & count)
10116 {
10117  (void) stop_mapper; // suppress unused parameter warning
10118 
10119  if (thread_ref.tran_index != tran_index)
10120  {
10121  // not the right transaction
10122  return;
10123  }
10124  if (thread_ref.lockwait == NULL)
10125  {
10126  // not a lock waiter
10127  return;
10128  }
10129  tran_lock_waiters[count++] = &thread_ref;
10130 }
10131 
10132 //
10133 // lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads - gather all threads belonging to transaction and waiting for lock
10134 //
10135 // tran_index (in) : transaction index
10136 // tran_lock_waiters (out) : output lock waiter threads belonging to transaction
10137 // count (out) : output thread count
10138 //
10139 static void
10140 lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads (int tran_index, tran_lock_waiters_array_type & tran_lock_waiters,
10141  size_t & count)
10142 {
10143  thread_get_manager ()->map_entries (lock_get_transaction_lock_waiting_threads_mapfunc, tran_index,
10144  tran_lock_waiters, count);
10145 }
